column2: yo these ghosts scary af ong

Even in it's current form (as of Sep 18 2022) this game is intense.  Some things aren't quite clear like what phrases  you can say with the spirit box (google search you'll find a ton of things), or how to "stop a hunt with the crucifix" (many holding, dropping on the floor, etc. have not worked yet).  But the tutorial does a great job of telling you how and why to use various items like the DOT, temperature gauge, etc.  Lighting things like the smudge stick, candle, etc. is a little awkward yet using the lighter...  But the locations are fun.  When activity spikes to a 10 and doors lock, and you're hearing screams, and lights flicker so you know "it's there" with you...  It's scary and intense!  BUT AWESOME!  Play with friends.  Triangulate positions.  Watch the monitoring trend lines. GREAT co-op fun.  Highly recommended!

But seriously, for a game that isn't fully released, it is really fun. Especially once you learn what you're doing.

for it's price this game is really fun (especially with friends) and heck, even if you are solo it's still really fun to play. it starts off pretty frightening when you're not used to the mechanics, but once you get a hang of it the game gets really good. would recommend no matter if you're solo or with a group.

but there are still some things needed, but that is a given since it's in early access as of me writing this; the public lobbies sound really bad atm (never personally tried it), there are a few bugs here and there but those usually gets fixed, and also the fact that this game isn't really that friendly with potato computers (i would know since i go through the pain of playing this game with one) however other than that this game has a ton of potential. Even the Phasmo scene on Youtube is doing well,  with a number of youtubers playing this game on stream or even just posting vids about it.

It will be amazing to see how the game will turn out once it does get out of early access.

Love this game. Spent close to 70 hours having fun with random people in pub lobbies, it's a breath taking leap into horror tactical and (the first one to do it)

This is by far the best horror multiplayer game in recent memory. Not only has Phasmophobia birthed a new genre of games, it has continued to reign supreme in this space. This game is well worth the price. If you have 3 other friends, I would highly recommend it

Pros:

Development team is amazing and works at lighting speeds to deliver content seemingly every other month. There have been numerous large scale patches, new maps, a ton of new ghost types, new equipment, new settings coming soon (in terms of the time of this review). 

The ghosts are all unique, challenging, but rewarding to figure out. 

Cursed possessions have added a new layer of gameplay along with the equipment additions, this game 

Amazing VR support, you can team up with those playing in VR as well, making for some goofy moments watching someone physically freak out during a haunt.

The map sizes really make a game, the high school may be one of the best maps in my opinion, the maps are clearly unique, all have their own challenges and are designed well (outside of asylum but it's getting a rework!)

The ghost events can really give you a jump scare and are sometimes truly creepy

Cons:

The difficulty of some ghosts can be overwhelming, I can tell at the higher levels that less experienced players will have a very hard time figuring out evidence especially on nightmare

Sometimes the weather can cause severe FPS drops, really hindering 

I have no doubt the dev team has this in mind, but I would really like to see more counterplay during a haunt. As it sits right now, you currently only have two options, loop the ghost or hide and pray it doesn't find you.

This game is a ton of fun with friends, hit and miss with randoms, but overall well worth the price of admission. (especially on sale!) I have played mostly with a premade squad and find that the experience is almost always better that way as there are some high level randoms out there that will speedrun rounds faster than you can turn the power on! The variety of ghosts to hunt extends this games shelf life way beyond titles like Devour, and the use of equipment to lock down clues as well as cursed items and match objectives make the experience much more varied. The difficulty selection is also well thought out and at higher levels makes the slower, methodical hunting of lower difficulties melt away to be replaced by frantically searching for clues the minute the door opens because the ghost is not waiting around and the tables quickly turn. All in all I had a blast and easily recommend this game! :]

A perfectly spooky game, without any "real/cheap" jump scares (other than an easter egg).
Barely any blood or gore (except static blood in the level geometry, half-rotten ghost models and a mostly decomposed skeleton).
Game mostly relies on audio for spooking the players.

You try to figure out which ghost you're dealing with, by figuring out it's location and looking at it's behavior.
For this you have a wide variety of mostly unique items to use.
By accumulating knowledge about the game, you can figure out which ghost it is, much more easily.

The game has fun buggy mechanics, that can be learned naturally through playing the game.
(Remote controlled items, infinite sanity pills, free items, dislocated doors, escaping investigation area during hunt, entering area without unlocking door etc.)
But these might get patched. However pulling them of or figuring them out feels super rewarding.
And some of them have a chance of failing. But getting a successful locker escape on Bleasedale, when cornered is some joy you won't be able to reproduce easily.

Ghosts feel like they have different "personalities" making it entertaining to play multiple times, including randomized hiding spots.

For most people this will be a rather short-lived experience, as figuring out the way the ghost work, take away a bit of constant tension, when playing the game.
I'd say many people would only enjoy playing this for around 15 hours.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Can be very fun, especially when playing with the right people.

One thing I would change however is how the ghosts behave. It gets a little old when the ghost always wants to kill you. What if you added different hostility levels? It'd be more interesting if you enter the game, not knowing whether or not the ghost will try to harm and kill you, and instead just wants you to find its body, or how it died, or even have certain ghost types "only" destroy your equipment instead of making you lost everything you've put into the match just because you die. Currently if you play on higher difficulties and you want to hoard your items it encourages you to stay in the van and hide instead of going in and actually exploring (especially if you're a coward like me :P).

While I'm reviewing, I'd also suggest different kill animations. I'm sick of every single ghost having the same icky hands on my poor eyes, whether it's the child, or the creepy Ring/Grudge ghost, or an old man with a sickle. The death sound of the hands wrapping around my neck is also getting old, and I'd suggest changing that aspect up a little as well.

Phasmophobia is one of the few horror games that are actually good. From communicating to the ghost, to exploring the huge maps, there are a variety of things you can do in the game. Phasmophobia has also helped my fear of horror and now I only s*** my pants once when playing the game or watching horror movies. The items in Phasmophobia are also really well built and easy to use most the time. The cursed items can be useful for locating the ghost and fit really well in the game. The fact that the ghost can hear you and respond to you inside the house is astonishing to me. When using the spirit box. it gives unique answers to questions and you can even ask how many bottles can you fit up your butt on the Ouija board. Also, the ghost being able to hear you when it hunts is scary as hell. Just hiding makes your heart beat hoping you don't make one noise. The different types of ghosts are also really cool. From Spirits to Obakes, they each have their unique traits which help when figuring out what ghost it is. The ghost events also gives you a small scare each time it happens. I never know if the ghost is hunting or if it's a ghost event when it does a ghost event. The variety of maps are also huge. With the smallest maps having 11 rooms, and the Asylum having a whopping 101 rooms, it really makes it a thrill exploring the place. A lot of the maps seem to fit the haunted feeling as well like a house, farmhouse, camp lodge, prison, and a school. One thing I don't really like about the game is the VR compatibility. Maybe a few fixes here and there will make the VR experience a lot better, but the VR experience (even if a little buggy) is also a thrilling experience. I would definitely recommend this game for people seeking horror. If your too scared to play the game, face your fears! I went into this game scared sh*tless, but after a bit got the hang of it and now I'm level 101 (at the time of this message). Some people may find the game boring, but if you play some of the bigger maps and take more risks, it's a fun and thrilling game. Highly recommend this game.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

I tried to feed this back in the Phasmophobia discord to avoid them a negative game rating, but then I got told that suggestions have been closed, and that they will only ask for feedback on specific things. 

The journal in the game is too bright when opened. Everything in the game is dark, spooky and dimly lit, yet when you open the journal, I hope you've got sunglasses on, because that thing is BLINDING. Chuck away your strong flashlights, and just press J to illuminate everything. It would be great to get the book to be a bit darker, especially as the contract between everything else in the game and the journal can be quite jarring. As a quick fix, just bringing down the brightness would work, but in the future, the flashlight or a lighter to illuminate the journal would be really useful. 

"The channel game-suggestions has been closed. Instead of taking game-suggestions, channels will be created for specific topics that we want suggestions for. Keep an eye on the "Feedback" category in Discord for the latest suggestions channels. 

If the channel is open, please stick to any format in place and read the Developers' messages before posting for rules, guidelines, or specific ideas they may be looking for.  Please try not to use other channels as an area to "request" game ideas. Happy Hunting!"

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicin

An excellent game to play with friends. Still in early access but already a solid game. It's less "Blair Witch" and more like those "Ghost Hunters" TV shows. I look forward to what they add in the future.

The Good:
* Game is "Scary" without being "Graphic".
* Even once you're used to it, it can still startle you because you aren't ready for something.
* The higher difficulties and slight randomization of certain elements keeps the game fun even when you've played it to death.
* The maps all have their own quirks which keeps things interesting and gives variety.

The Bad: (Almost entirely stuff that they're either working to fix or are bugs that will likely be fixed)
* The voice detection is a bit wonky at times, either mis-hearing or not hearing you at all.
* A few maps have weird geometry issues where you look safe but the ghost can see *and* catch you.
* The large maps can be frustrating to play solo, especially if you're trying to complete all the objectives and not just identify the ghost.
* The Photo Camera tool is inconsistent in what it picks up (You can be 2 ft away from a ghost and pointing the camera straight at it, but it either won't register or identifies the wrong thing)
* The random nature of the ghost interacting with objects can make them frustrating to identify.

Phasmophobia is the current king of the Ghost Hunting genre. Probably the best aspect of this game is the level of inductive reasoning required to find, identify, and survive the ghost. Careful thought and thorough playtesting has gone into the current iteration of the game, and it shows! Bugs exist, but are not game-breaking and generally not severe. If you like solving puzzles, or your work involves troubleshooting things, this game will utilize those skills.

Phasmophobia is a game that requires patience and rewards keen observation. Basically, the primary goal is to identify the species of ghost present at a location, with secondary objectives such as getting a photograph of the entity (easier said than done), or successfully using a cross to stop it from attacking you. What makes phasmophobia so good is that they have devoted probably most of their development time into the one aspect that most developers put the least: playtesting and mechanics. Their goal is to make differences between the species subtle but definite, requiring experimentation to sort out aspects. You have to experiment and repeat to ensure that you are observing unique behavior, as RNG can make ghosts seem to exhibit certain behaviors that they do not. It is so fantastically well done, few other games match it, because it requires a lot of time to really appreciate it, and such deep AI mechanisms do not make for great store page videos. An example of this is the "twinteraction". One species, "the Twins", can interact with two objects at the exact same time. RNG allows other ghosts to interact with the same object twice immediately, or two close objects ALMOST immediately, but not two seperate objects at exactly the same time. You need to pay keen attention to behaviour to sus out what is going on. At the same time, another Ghost, the "Oni", has an ability where it can throw an object much further than others, while yet another, the "Poltergeist" can throw several objects at once. Subtle, but definitive if you are paying attention.

Another example would be the "Mare". This ghost likes darkness and has a slightly higher chance to turn lights off when it passes a light switch. Again, it's all RNG, and most ghosts can turn the lights off, but the Mare has maybe a 50% chance of interacting with the switch where others have a 30% chance (nobody, save the devs, knows the exact numbers here). Paying keen attention will pay off. Another species, the "Mimic", can temporarily take on the behavior of other ghosts, it picks one for a few minutes, exhibits all that ghost's behaviors, then switches to another, acting as a spoiler for all.

And here is where Phasmophobia gets you. You are destracted, you are paying keen attention to the evidence, then the ghost attacks you (hunts). You are caught off guard, you can run or hide, but you can't fight. If it catches you, it will kill you. Each hunts differently, at different speeds, and while you are trying to stay alive, you are also looking for unique behaviours. It is slow burn psychological terror, and I absolutely love it.

This game was almost meme-worthy when it was released on Early Access. You would swear at a ghost to attract its ire, then force it on a slow speed chase, cackling like a hyena. Since then, its become a game where all bets are off. The Ghost has Predator Vision. It can now occasionally sprint like a Jaguar in the jungle if it feels so inclined. It can also murder in rapid succession, so If all of your team hides in the same closet giggling like kids in church when the priest falls asleep mid-sermon, you're all toast. And If you even think of using the Scooby Doo method of hiding behind a couch, you will lose the mortal game of Hide-and-Seek and be left with skid marks and a loss of pride. 10/10 Would recommend.

Definitely a pioneer and what popularized the ghost hunting horror genre. The game is well balanced and rarely feels unfair as the outcome of whether you succeed a mission(or fail) is mainly based upon your observation skills to read ghost behavior, collect evidence, and ability to evade the ghost during violent hunts. You have various equipment you can buy(in game money ofc) to aid you along your search for the ghost. Each ghost has its own unique qualities, behaviors, and special abilities which helps keep the tension throughout the mission as you're trying to figure out the type. Speaking of tension, the scary aspects of the game come from tension building of ghost interactions and the adrenaline rushing hunts rather than a cheap jumpscare. There is a wide variety of maps that helps mix up the gameplay and keep it fresh. Playing solo is just as rewarding(if not more) as multiplayer and replay value is really high. Lastly and most importantly, the game devs are one of the most well responsive and dedicated to their fanbase. There are usually regular updates (and if not then they are working on a massive update) that bring fun and interesting content- ghosts, maps, graphic overhauls, and an upcoming custom gamemode. I have even seen a hotifix update come out the next day after a major update. Although the game is early access, bugs are very minor and gameplay goes on smoothly with not much performance issues(also no crash issues).

P.S. despite having watched a ton of gameplay on this game before buying it, I pretty much binge-played the game the moment I bought it. I have major respect for the developers and honestly the pricing is definitely generous. Much love DK, CJ, Skinner, and Lavender

So to put this in perspective, I really stopped enjoying games for quite some time, up until the start of August. Now I don't often give my review or thoughts on games either since I feel like it can be misleading as you cannot sum up everyone's experience or what their potential experience may be like.

So what I love about this game is you can have so much fun by yourself and with friends. With friends you may make magical moments where one of them may crash and fall apart as they had fear forced right through them by one of the many ghostly entities the game offers. And alone, you realise it is truly that, you alone with one potentially angry ghost doing anything to wipe your existence, whether it be by strangling, making you run or just simply by making your heart beat so fast that it explodes. Regardless, it does keep you on edge.

Now we have 4 difficulties right now, amateur and intermediate which both offer  a beginners level of game play and everything is generally much slower, less freakier. As you play more, you'll realise doing anything on these is so boring that it becomes difficult. Next we have professional, it's very much a dive right into the action, you have less places to hide and well, the ghost may hunt when it is ready, however quick it may be. Then we have nightmare... this will challenge you and everything you know about the game.. you get 2 bits of evidence, and the third will be your knowledge.

Now I've enjoyed 78 hours of this game, and admittedly, nightmare is the most fun I've had because may not always succeed as you may in other difficulties, you may guess the wrong ghost which leaves nothing but a deeply gutting feeling... but no worries! It will be a lesson for next time! You got it right? You feel more rewarded than ever because your knowledge lead you to some success!

Once you have guessed the ghost, you have 2 options, go big or go home. Now the thing that adds so much more level of gameplay is when you decide to go big and risk it all. Risk your equipment, your rewards all in the chance of increasing your rewards by attempting to complete 3 set challenges. Sometimes they may be easy, sometimes they may be difficult, but none the less, it is something else to make those games just a bit more exciting!

With custom difficulty just round the corner, I feel as if it will only add to the game, the depth that it offers and give it far more replayability and far more challenging but yet entertaining gaming hours!

I’ll start by saying ever since the game’s release i’ve heard all about it’s hype and reviews but never bought into it, it never appealed to me; i had no reason to hate nor like it since i hadnt played it for myself. Until one day i was unfathomably bored and decided to purchase it. This decision would mortally wound my steam wallet forever. Phasmophobia has more than one map but dont worry you’ll only be playing on one map, i’ll get into that in a bit. So i paid 14 bucks, money that is earned with blood sweat and tears and spent a long, grueling 4 hours to hear discord mods and their kittens moaning and frolicking in open lobbies when i can literally do that on discord FOR FREE. Besides the uncomfortable and unfortunate lobbies, the game isnt fun either. Catching a ghost is like rocket science and if you haven’t gotten a couple hundred hours, expect to be carried each and every time during your experiences. You’ll spend the first two hours or more dicking around with the equipment instead so say goodbye to the 2 hour refund policy. And another thing, every other public lobby is on the basic house map. Why? Fuck me in the ass if i know. You pay 14 bucks for a game and you’re only interested in playing on the basic ass house map.m? Pfft. I asked a dude why he didn’t want to play on a larger or scarier map like ‘the aslyum’ and he says because it was too long and a lil spooky, well isn’t that the point of a horror game? Exploring and getting scared shitless? Nah, apparently phasmophobia is about replaying the same fucking starter house mission BS over and over again until you exhaust all your braincells. Being tagged as a horror game is just BS, the “jumpscares” are mediocre at most, and they’re rare unless you intentionally seek them out. The game plays more like a bland puzzle strategy game rather than a horror; However i must say that losing my money and time is much more horrific than whatever “content” this game has. the whole game— atmosphere, functions, animations, character models, and details just look like a refurbished gmod minigame. ive played better games that are free. Hell, the starter tutorial didn’t even work properly for me, or maybe it did but who would fucking know! It went through step by step with my how to catch a ghost and identify it, sounds easy enough right? I used every single fucking gadget in batman’s arsenal and still didnt detect a single ghost in the house, not a single light turned off, not a single reading from the EMP, nothing nada from every single gadget. But guess what? When i finally ended the tutorial mission it revealed that there WAS a ghost. If this is a horror game why are the ghosts and monsters not prevalent at all? It didnt even so much as fart itself so i would know its there! Cmon! if you want to play phasmophobia but for a lower price and get 1000% more for your money, just straight up buy Gmod. In the end, i really truly do feel empty after just 4 hours and 14 bucks. Its almost impressive how this game put me down worse than depression ever could. I didn’t feel any joy or anticipation while the game downloaded and im sure the game felt none back. The whole time i played phasmophobia i was just thinking in the back of my head if i should refund or keep going to grasp the game mechanics. And why it was even made to cost 14 bucks in the first place. Cheap blow devs, cheap blow. Not being a cheapskate either, i just don’t think the game is even worth its price. if it was free then i would be a little more lenient with my harsh rating. Sadly the negatives outweigh the positives 10 to none and the price tag on it seals my rating.

TLDR:
0/10 shit game wouldnt play again.

I am a 52 year old father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my son, who is now 14. My son recently downloaded Phasmophobia and in less than a week, he had already played for over 20 hours. This was terrible for me, as it was already hard enough for me to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching videos on Tiktok. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought my son and I closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Incredible potential but still a work in progress. Amazing in VR mode, It is one of the few horror games to genuinely build tension and deliver scares and the mechanics can force players into tense decisions about whether it is worth the risk to return to the house to find that last piece of evidence or if your sanity is so low you might be attacked the second you set foot in the door.

The evidence gathering manages to be fun while still being similar from round to round and each mechanic does a good job of immersing the player in the game. At first nothing is creepier than getting a ghost to respond to you on spirit box saying he is right behind you.

 However the imersion of the gameplay begins to wane after the first few levels acheived and the once imposing ghosts become more of a nuisance than a threat barring RNG giving you the 1 in 12 chance of picking the most dangerous ghost type. I hope more work can be done on this game to preserve the experience I had on my first hunt as a greenhorn ghost hunter unsure if any second an otherworldly being could end my existence. Perhaps more varied goals or unpredictable hunting behavior would force methodical veteran hunters to take risks or face the uncertainty that terrifies you when first playing this game

I am a HUGE scaredy-cat but I can't get enough of this game.  It's terrifying and getting caught by the ghost makes me scream, but it's awesome to actually simulate ghost hunting with a group of friends.  The play through can be chill while collecting evidence with cool equipment or you can mess around with cursed objects and run for your life.  I haven't played on VR but headphones are still immersive with freaky sounds and it's really cool that your words affect the outcome of the experience.  Even if you are afraid of horror games, this is one that I would recommend for anyone to try at least once.  It's SO FUN!!

Playing with friends in VR, we weren't really enjoying it.

Basic things like just joining a room are incredibly annoying as there is no "invite to game" option, you have to send a code for your friends to copy and paste. And then once in a lobby, not even in game, you can't change your settings. Juggling items and working with the UI when in a game are extremely terrible, frequently you will go to grab one thing and end up grabbing another as they are placed too close together and don't give clear interaction feedback to prevent that from happening (unlike, say, H3VR). Trying to quickly turn off your electronics in a hunt is a nightmare as you have to perfectly release the item on your belt, otherwise you will drop it on the ground. I wish they used controller holograms with grab points instead of physical hands to make interactions work better in VR. Even basic functionality like changing settings in the menu doesn't work reliably.

 If even these basic things don't work properly, how are we supposed to trust the actual game mechanics work as intended? 

It doesn't seem to work well with smaller player counts as some of the mechanics such as monitoring from the van are basically unavailable, and you aren't able to take as many items with you.

The main challenge to overcome to get better seems to be learning to survive hunts, and clearly little thought was put into how players are supposed to learn to do this properly. Because hunts only happen after a lengthy amount of time on a map and can be over in seconds, there is almost no time to practice the different actions needed to survive. So you don't get frequent opportunities to get better, and you get no feedback on how well you did since it's survive / die (and you might only survive because it went after a teammate instead of you, not because you played well). Even worse is the lack of communication of how the ghost actually works and what it's doing.

It seems like once you actually figure that stuff out it just gets repetitive and boring.

Ah yes Phasmophobia, what an illustrious exciting game based off Unity Assets. It's very fun playing with friends unless your friends are like mine of course; they just want to kill me with the cursed objects and want me to suffer in pain whilst they gain the experience and I just sit there on my death bed. I'd say Puffafish and Byr0 are the worst for it, that man would rush the cursed object before I even have time to load in, I swear he has a vengeance against me. Whilst Zornadoh on the other hand is continously trying to find the ghost and he has 3 melons following him (myself included). Slower, what can I say he is a cool guy and never upsets anyone although if he's last alive then damn he's running out of there faster than Usain Bolt. Overall a fantastic game to vibe late night with friends if you want to get hunted down by a Wraith or a Thaye before the hunt even starts as your friends hate you as much as mine hate me. I highly recommend.

Absolutely awesome game. I got it because a friend recommended it. I have played Amnesia and I know I hate jump scares even though I love the horror genre. I was hesitant too because I hate being chased. But you know what, I'm so glad I did! This game is addicting. I'm now lvl 600 and I'm still learning. No ghost hunt is ever the same. We've had scares, laughs, crazy stuff and it's always a fun time, especially with the right people. Also, the fear factor does go down a bit. So while it's scary at first, you get more used to it so it's not a game that's gonna be scary forever. I love this game, if you're on the fence, get it! Also a tip, join the Discord and find people to play with through LFG if you can't find people to play with. Much better than joining the in game public lobbies.

Really fun game, particularly if playing co-op. After over 40 hours I still get scared and anxious - which is what I want from a horror game! The ghosts are unpredictable to an extent so the scare factor never completely goes away. There is a huge variety of ghost types to work out which means more variety for each map you play. A decent range of map sizes and locations. And overall, the game is just plain FUN, which it should be, especially as you gain more knowledge of the secrets behind each ghost! It is very rewarding to have the odd moment where you figure out which ghost it is based on its behaviour/footstep speed during hunt etc.

Possibly my favourite thing is the dev team, who care so very much about this game. Asides from the frequent patches, updates, plans, it's nice to see that some of the team also play the game casually from time to time - this gives them genuine insight from the perspective of a normal player, not enough devs do this.  I have some vague recollection of there being "horror" updates, where the dev team are very steadily adding creepy horror elements to the game - what a wonderful idea, as this keeps things fresh. What I'd *like* to see in the future, which I have no doubt will happen anyway, is more maps and perhaps more interactivity with the maps (e.g. secrets rooms that you have to find a switch to open, rare items to collect much like the current "bones"), and also more evidence types perhaps? And rewards for levelling up! (When you do the level reset, perhaps you have to reach certain levels to unlock certain items?)

Overall i think it's a worthy investment. The game has nuance and replay value. Huge well done to DK and his team. You have created something very special, which is still beloved 2 years down the line.

This game is great. I was terrified of it at first, hated being in the house ever. Now I will run in, pull all the tarot cards and hide in a cupboard desperately trying not to laugh so I don't get killed alongside my friends. 
Despite a seemingly small number of ghost types and maps, there are endless possibilities. I have been fooled many times thinking the ghost is one thing only for it to turn out to be another, especially on nightmare. 
You can play as an absolute being of chaos, not caring who you kill or how, or even if you die yourself, or you can play it seriously, taking your time and putting in every effort to work out what the ghost is. Both ways are fun.
As a bonus, the devs are very active in the community, both on reddit and discord, and in the chats of big phasmo twitch streamers, so they listen to feedback, answer questions, and probably laugh at people's misfortunes while playing. They also have some Big Things in the works that are coming soon that everyone is very excited for.

This is a spooky game that is full of spooky ghosts and it is up to you and your team to solve what kind of spooky ghost is haunting the area. Many a time have I entered the various locations in the game, but they are made to feel fresh by the different spooky ghosts that haunt it each time. At the time of my writing this review, I have accrued 119 hours in the game, and I am still looking forward to gathering a group of my friends and entering the haunted locations once more. 
          The deductive nature that the players must have in the game makes for an entertaining role to play. Typically early in the game everybody is fearless, with no concern of being hunted. As the investigation goes on and players' sanity begins to drop, it becomes ever more frightening to search for clues. The thrills of going in to the house to collect one last clue to positively identify the entity while on your last bit of sanity and making it out of the house alive proves to be such a rush that it has my friends and I coming back again and again.
         Also the game is still in early access, and still has room to improve. I have experienced some jankiness in the vr mode, but nothing that has kept me from enjoying the game. would recommend vr mode as well.
           

         TLDR:  Its a fun spooky game with spooky ghosts that I would recommend for players using mouse and keyboard as well as VR

Probably one of the best horror experiences i've ever had. one of the only games where you can play with your friends, goof around and the game is still scary. 

you can also play solo. the game is balanced for both Solo play and Co-Op if you don't have any friends playing the game you can join strangers on public lobbies. your goal is simple you need to find out what ghost you are dealing with and if you want a challenge you can ramp up the difficulty and complete side objectives. the ghosts have different personalities and abilities so there is a learning curve. based on your knowledge you can complete missions easier and faster so there is really fun gameplay loop here.

the things above were all the positive stuff about the game now for some of the negative ones. the game has several big and small sized maps. the big maps in this game are not very fun. sometimes ghost rooms are really hard to find and they like to roam around and there is not many hiding spots if the ghost catches you in a big room or hallway it's really hard to get away from. some aggressive ghosts are annoying to play against in the big maps. 

the is still in Early Access. the updates are frequent and meaningful with active Devs posting what they are working on. overall it's worth the price.

The idea of this game is great, but it isn't put into action that well. This is a ghost hunting game where you have to find 3 types of evidence to figure out the ghost. But the evidence, even on the easiest difficulty, is unreasonably hard to find, there is no easy way to understand where the ghost's "favorite room" is to find evidence. the tutorial is absurd and not helpful in the slightest. All the tutorial does is put you in a normal game alone. Now the actual game is where it gets a little worse. The evidence is hard to find, the ghost is unreal no matter the difficulty. it takes a good 40 minutes per match average if you want to be super sure.  And don't get me started on the ghost hunting. The ghost, once allowed to hunt, can just hunt whenever. And the lower your sanity is, it will hunt more, for longer, with less time between hunts. Which makes sense, but not when you get to below 20 sanity. Which is very easy to get to, it will hunt for about a minute, and the has a very high chance to hunt a couple seconds after hunting, giving you no time to get any work done. And this makes it hard because maybe you finally figure out what the ghost is, you sprint for the exit. It is now or never, no closets to hide in nearby, no where to run but the exit. You get right there and... hunting. It locks the door and starts hunting, the 20-30 minutes you spent trying to figure out what it is, gone. I love the idea this game brings and I love ghost hunting, but when it isn't made to be fun despite being a game, it isn't that great. I have 11 hours as of writing this review and I have never successfully won and guessed the ghost correctly without dying on the EASIEST difficulty. This game isn't really a casual game. I want to love this game, but they make it hard to. And I'm gonna be honest, this game is not worth buying unless it is on sale :/

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

When Phasmophobia came out it was ahead of the pack, it was a fresh take on horror games. It has an investigative side that thrills you not by pitting you necessarily against a timer but your hiding skills and practical skills.

Then it stagnated. They've added a few new ghosts here and there but there aren't that many maps which makes it frustrating to play over and over. They're planning one cosmetic change to a map in a future update but that's it.

The number of players has always been and will always be no more than 4. This is great if you like the challenge. Sometimes however you want to play with more friends. Other similar games allow up to 6 players in a team/group. This would be great on the larger maps like school, campsite, prison and asylum(soon to be renamed Sunny Meadows). I feel there should be up to 6 allowed on these maps. Even the ghost seems to get lost or unable to keep up with how big these maps are.

Other games have added additional features like being able to banish or temporarily trap the ghost if you determine what the ghost type is correctly.

An update to the graphics would be great but not necessary.

Maybe instead of just adding more ghosts with similar abilities give them new ones such as walking on the ceiling, being able to drag you, etcetera.

Even changing the way you can be killed, or what appears on your death screen could be great for example a bloody scene instead of just hands folding over your eyes everytime.  

Lastly, this isn't a complaint but would love to see it translated to Arabic like some of the newer competition has done even if it is just community translated.

This is a review of the VR mode, not the flatscreen one. 

Absolutely awful VR mode. After the VR overhaul they made it worse.

Heres some of the many things wrong with the VR mode

. Objects hold weird
. Objects throw weird
. The notebook is in an uncomfortable spot to reach
. Performance is absolutely awful
. No finger tracking for index users, or capacitive support.
. You can't change your bindings for the game
. Bindings for the index are unbearably awful. It forces you to use thumbstick to sprint, which causes drift on the controllers over time
. Doors open weird, they were fine before the overhaul
. Objects are harder to put into your belt than before
. Your hand is very jittery when holding an item
. You can only see your hands, and there is no option to see your arms, and or body
. Your hands don't change skin color depending on your avatar
. You dont collide with objects unless you pick them up
. When objects collide with each other its very buggy

The game gets boring once you get good too, or when you play with friends that are good at the game. Updates are infrequent as well. Its super bug ridden too.

If you're not playing in vr, and only looking to get 20ish hours of content out of this game, I recommend it.

I used to really love this game, then the latest updates show the clear decent this game is going.
They added many ghosts instead of optimizing the game, most of the ghosts on the list hardly show up anyway.
The problems, Ghosts:
Constantly walking through walls
Killing not even close to you
Spawning in completely different areas consistently(sometimes the ghost spawns where it despawned after a hunt)
Ghosts teleporting
Had a few times it killed without even going into a hunt, door remained open
We witnessed two ghosts in two different areas and we thought "oh this is cool it must be twins" nope, not twins.
Most ghosts do not follow any pattern in the book.  An example is the wraith: stepping in salt, leaving footprints, and its footsteps are very audible.

A lot of my friends with VR's are constantly having crashes when being killed, the game locks up as they get to its lair. 
The reflections KILL frame rate and the worst map for it is campgrounds, even my non VR friends have frame rate drops.

When you learn how to play, the game is actually fun, only thing id wish is variety and randomisation optimisation since after playing for a while the game becomes very repetitive.

Things i noticed, liked and or would like to see changed:

Sound Design is awesome and well done, most of the jump scares / appearances feel natural / good.

Thing the game needs most like i stated is variety, and more unique level design, since majority of maps feel like a mirrored version of another map with some rooms added/removed.

Ghost design should also be improved and make the game less forgiving. you can basically just hide behind a door in a hunt and the ghost wont know your there.

Add more voice stuff, yelling "give us a sign" over and over again ruins the mood.

Overall ambient, sound, gadget, gameplay mechanics design is awesome and executed really well.

Multiplayer works as intended, very fun and spooky with friends if especially if you play for the first time.

Games very good, and i think its the best out of all possible "paranormal activity" and scary multiplayer games.

I feel like if they improve on the variety of maps, ghost events, jump scares, ghost appearances, objectives, way ghosts behave, add more "scary" id say.

After the hours (6) i played the game sort of feels like a game to grind, or speed run.

Like i said not a bad game, but needs things listed above to keep people coming to play.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked a song and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he taught me how to play. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

This game saved my life.

I am 27.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you

What can I say about Phas that isn't already well known to the gaming community? This has got to be one of the most iconic horror games ever made, and it's not even complete yet. 
If you haven't played this game yet and you like horror games, then what the heck are you waiting for? Get it now and start playing! This game never gets boring and is a blast to play with others. It's just nonstop fun and spooks left and right. 

I will say the character models and movements are very jank (but also hilarious) and likely are low on the dev's list flesh out. Some maps could use little tweaks here and there to improve the efficiency of your ghost hunting, but it's still unfinished. So don't fret too much about bugs or graphical quirks. Controller support needs a lot of work too in my opinion. So only plan to play this on mouse and keyboard if you don't want to get stuck opening a door during a ghost hunt and die. 

Also, there could stand to be more maps to choose from. They have all 48 continental US states on the map but only have about 10 locations, 6 of which are small street houses or farm houses. These are good to have in order to have quick levels to play, but the game could benefit from more variety in the medium to large sized maps. There's a lot of missed potential with FL, GA, LA, and MA given the amount of famously "haunted" locations there are in those states.

Final verdict: 9.5/10 - Excellent replayability, good scary atmosphere, tons of spooks, great multiplayer, and a good difficulty system that rewards players for better knowledge of the game and the ghost's mechanics. Just needs more maps, some polish, and to be finished.

If you're here for state of the art graphics, high FPS, or bugless gameplay, this might not be the game for you. This is a game that has a lot of glitches and bugs (it's a feature!), but also a lot of heart. And jump-scares. It's genuinely very fun with a group of friends, and while the clunky controls might be frustrating at the start, it does feel rewarding to keep playing. You will get better at it, and you'll start to learn ghost behavior. It feels worthwhile to spend your time in-game! Your heart will race, you'll belly-laugh, and you'll create inside jokes with your friends that will never get old. 

Also, have a look around your safe room! There are some fun easter eggs.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.
Overall, an awesome game. Tends to lag for me, but that's probably just my PC being old. Lots of fun with friends.

For the longest time I only tried out Training (8 hours), because I didn't have the nerve to put myself at risk in an actual mission.  But a couple weeks ago, I finally tried my first mission.  So far I've done 27 of them and haven't died yet.  I'm now level 17, but I haven't tried Professional yet... 

After you figure out the right way to go about most safely investigating ghosts and going for the best rewards you can, you might think the game could stand to offer a little more.  I've seen other ghost hunting games that add more activities and make the ghosts more active and energetic, but this game has a simplicity that encourages its very effective dread.  I do hope the developers find ways to add more activities that don't subtract from the game's already very strong points.

(Update: I've done 35 total missions, 8 on Pro, and I died twice - still learning the ropes.  Ghosts aren't as predictable as I thought.  Especially the Mimic, which got me both times...)

(Update 2: Now up to 53 missions and level 37, been playing Pro ever since.  Still only the two deaths, mainly because I learned to keep my sanity up and be cautious about Demons, Yokai and Mimics.  I do enjoy the unpredictable nature of the game.  If things happened too regularly, it would be a lot less scary.  I don't really push for perfect games (full set of pictures) just yet, since that takes more time and risks my sanity dropping low and being subjected to hunts.  But I do try to figure out the ghost type, even if that means spending a little extra time trying to rule out other evidence when I'm not detecting what I need.)

After only 52 hours In this game I can say this is a wonderful investigation styled horror game.  Here are some pro's and Con's to this game so far.

Pro's
- Great visuals, Music, and Sounds
- Variety of ghost models, shapes, sizes, and movement animations
- Variety of tools and equipment that aid in the investigation
- Ghosts have unique hidden abilities that allow the player to immerse themselves in an investigative mindset
- The maps are well crafted and very enjoyable for each investigation
- Multiplayer is enjoyable, and usually friendly to new and old players
- Smooth multiplayer, for the most part
- Regular content additions, bug fixes, and general updates to the game!
- Different difficulty levels that allow the players to test their investigative knowledge
- The game is still early development and costs less than most games.
- In-game built in voice recognition
- always given the basic equipment needed to find the ghost
- Tons of replayability, and more but ill leave it at that for now

Con's
- Some placement and movement bugs that continue to get flushed out with each update
- Minor bugs and fixes that aren't game breaking but can be noticed from time to time
- Minor ghost movement bugs
- Some larger maps feel more repetitive and empty, however that is being worked on for the next update
- The money system becomes useless after many successful matches, (However if you die a lot then you may struggle with this mechanic and not be able to afford certain equipment)
- The in game training is useless and very uninformative, along with the ghost journal that is suppose to explain the ghosts

Overall, I have fallen in love with this game, Its a beautiful balance between scary, uneasy, and investigative knowledge building.  You end up learning about each ghost and their ability's as you play within the community.  Also you get better and faster at finding the ghost, and items throughout the maps.  As time goes on, and you try harder difficulty modes, you find yourself growing in the knowledge of each individual ability with each ghost. Overall I would say this game is an 9/10, given that it is still early access and still has bug fixes and frequent large updates.

P.S. Look up Youtube videos from either Insym, or Bushwack 18 to discover knowledge about the items you use, and ghost types to help you better understand how to play.  The game gives a poor training tutorial on how the tools work and what you are looking for.  Don't let this small point ruin your time on such an enjoyable game.

Phasmaphobia is one of the most fun games I have played in a while. I don't think I will ever play it as I have never been good with horror/scares. But I can say with confidence when playing with friends that 1: Know how to play the game and 2: Have a good sense of humor, it is one of the best digital experiences you can have. 5 hours into my play-through and there is still so much more to this game. The gameplay although simple, does not have a repetitive feel as the different amount of evidence combinations can lead to different ghosts, and the fact that anytime (when on certain difficulties and above) a ghost hunt can start and you have to run and hide for your dear life as you stay as silent as death itself. Whether you survive or not (from my experience) is up to luck. If you complete the main objective of identifying the ghost, there are always sub-challenges for extra spice on the seasoning of this digital masterpiece that even Gordon Ramsey would have to approve. When it comes to the cons, I can't think of many. This might sound stupid, but I play this game on my school HP Laptop, and I have to lower almost all of the graphics to have a smooth experience. That is my only con. THAT, is all I can think of when it comes down to the negativity of the game.     The amount of ghost-to-map combinations are insane, as there are 24 ghosts and 10 maps, resulting in 240 different combinations of ghost identifications, and awesome play-throughs. If you are on the fence about getting this game, and you see this review, my one piece of advice. Gather your friends, and GET THIS GAME.

Lots of fun to discover and play with friends. Not so much replayability, not enough maps, quite frustrating bugs or game design flaws. For example, game objectives can be: Prevent ghost from hunting with a crucifix, but even if you place it just a few feet from the ghost location, it will spawn and kill you nonetheless. The objective could also be to take a photo of the ghost, which even if you do, won't matter for some reason and you won't get the objective, so you end up dying, losing all your gear and feeling like you have been played by the game itself because you did everything right and still lost. The game as a concept is great, but in its current state and judging by the speed at which this game updates, I fear there will be better options to choose from before it reaches a better state and has enough maps. I really believe community made maps would give this game the potential to be awesome. 6/10 or 3 stars out of 5.

Easily one of my favorite horror games. In singleplayer, the game is absolutely terrifying. Going into the dark house all by yourself always has you on the edge of your seat as you try to figure out what kind of ghost you're hunting. Every time I play singleplayer I always finish playing with my heart beating out of my chest from fear. This is a horror game that is actually scary and can leave you speechless (or in the case of my friend, paralyzed) from fear. The multiplayer is so much fun. Getting a couple friends together and going together to look for a ghost is one of my favorite way to spend my weekend nights. It is always so much fun, being both scared but also joking around with friends and trying to get the job done. Highly recommendable and anyone who hasn't played this game is missing out BIG TIME.

I'd recommend this game for what it is overall. Some things might look clunky a bit, but the game in itself is fun, easy to learn and play, and just spooky enough to get you a little kick when you start playing, even tho you're getting used to it quickly.

The only downside that comes to mind about this game, is how shi* the community might be sometime, teenagers with big ego and kids using cursed item behind your back, trying to get the rest of the squad getting killed is a problem, but at the same time, there's not much you can do to prevent that kind of stuff i guess. Other than that, i'm mostly having a great time playing it.

Do you like watching horror games, but think you're too chicken to play one? This game is for you! Grab some friends, pile in the truck and have a steak out, you'll have a good time even if you get your pants scared off.

Phasmaphobia is more than a horror game, it's an investigation and deduction game. Each ghost has it's unique combination of 3 types of evidence, AND each one also has it's own secret unique tell. Most of us learn these from other players and let's-players (Luv u Insym <3), so no matter how you learn the game, you get to flex your knowledge every match.

Don't be afraid to start from the bottom. If you wanna get some practice in, there's a tutorial level with a friendly ghost for you to gather evidence from! Play Amateur with your friends until you feel comfortable to try intermediate... and before you know it, you'll be identifying ghosts on nightmare like a professional sleuth.

Dive on in, face your fears. You wont regret it.

LOVE. THIS. GAME

SPAZMOPHOBIA - A Review Written by x0Salmon_Master0x

a good friend once told me "hey have you heard of a game called phasmophobia? we should well play it!" and ever since then, my life has been changed for the worse

there is nothing worse then loading up into a game, bricking myself before entering the house and chasing after an invisible person trying to check its temperature and trying not to get molested, getting left behind by your 'so-called-mates' and then getting killed and my friend taking a proper mug of me on the camera and making a tenner. i play this game in VR, which makes the little ghost demon chasing me 10x worse, i almost booted it once since i had flashbacks to vietnam when i volleyed these children for no reason, it was hilarious lmao he span around on the spot like sonic and shot off really really fast hahahah

i will share a secret with you. this is normally how talking to the ghost goes:

"hello are you there?"
*no answer*
"what is your name?"
*no answer*
"where are you?"
*no answer*
"how did you die?"
*no answer*
"please can you make yourself present and move something?"
*no answer*
"right f*ck off then"
*lights starts flashing and i am never to be seen again*

hunting a ghost named dave grinnigan has never been so much fun, apart from the fact that im sat behind a fridge silently whimpering to myself holding a crucifix while i hear my mandem pissing about with a plate and a microphone in the van. what is also my favourite part is the constant verbal abuse and hurling virtual punches at each other to decide who has to stay in the room alone and do the spirit box.

one reason i love this game is the ouija board. one time i asked it if it wanted to play scrabble and it immediately went dark and spread me open like a sket at 2am. it was the only time ive been chased by a woman. i only wanted to play a game with it. i remember vividly hiding in a wardrobe with my boy, and he suddenly farted and got us killed.

it is funny however to send in martin to have a friendly chinwag with the ghost strapped with a go-pro on his meathead and send him on his jollies, then to see our torches flash from inside the van, an abruptly long scream and then it cuts off suddenly and we see him folded into the letter 4 in a corner somewhere.


10/10 game though cant lie

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.
This is a good fun game and I 100% this game for other gamer's like myself :)

Love this game so much, it never gets old. From playing public matches to playing with friends. It is a bit scary at first but it gets so fun once you get better! Would definitely recommend buying it.

I have been interested in this game ever since seeing a couple of YouTubers playing when it was originally released in early access back in 2020. 
Earlier this year, a friend of mine gave it to me as a gift, and I have been playing it ever since. In the first couple of months I would only play it with my friends' squad, as I am a little squeamish - despite being a horror aficionado, I am not a great fan of playing horror games on my own. It has always been really fun to play, leading to some good and laughable moments with friends.
A couple of weeks ago, after having seen a lot of live streams on Twitch, I finally made the decision to venture on it solo and it has been a really cool experience. I am still a bit squeamish, but I now feel way more comfortable with the game and feel that it has very much improved my overall gameplay.
I recommend this game to any fan of the horror/supernatural genre and investigation games. Also if you are a fan of co-op games, I think you will have a blast at this with friends.
I have yet to try the game in VR but, from my experience so far, I love all aspects of the game. One thing I would like to see improved is some customisation options for the characters. That would be very cool.

Hiring new people to help with the project was the best decision that was done.
I am loving the new content and improvements that helped this game get out of its prototype-asset-flip-y phase.
A lot of other "ghost hunting" games tried to copy this game with no success, because they miss the key ingredients. Organic and not random jumpscares in your face every 10 seconds and building of atmosphere and eventual dread.

All I'd wish is for some balancing done towards the player's favor. For example when the ghost is hunting, you now have no indication that it is hunting unless you're very close to the ghost. In addition the ghost often is not visible, which might cause you to get killed with no chance to see it coming so you can plan and take action to protect yourself.

Can't wait for the new upcoming content and horror update.

Способы потерять друзей:
1) Взять доску Уиджи, встать около выхода из здания, начать задавать ей вопросы и выбежать из дома как только она ломается.
2) Аналогично встать около двери, взять карты таро, вытянуть Death и сразу же выбежать из дома.
3) Попросить не очень умного друга зажечь все 5 свечей пентаграммы.
4) Взять зачарованное зеркало, опустить с помощью него рассудок (НЕ ДРУГА) и сразу же залезть в шкаф.
5) Закрыть перед другом дверь шкафа во время охоты.
6) Новичку в игре показать скример с дверью в лобби.

This game is NOT SCARY to me.  I think it seems very scary watching youtube videos because since it's multiplayer there is usually at least one person that scares really easily.  If you are a fan of the Horror genre and don't scare easily than I would say stay away.  Also, the tutorial for the game is not great.   Because the tutorial was so ...lacking I went over the 2 hour limit and am stuck with this game.  I know I'm really hard to scare but I just don't get how this is scary to anyone.  Also, what ghost fighting story has everyone run into the house in seperate directions.  This game would be better if there had to be at least one person in the van helping with the surveilance equipment and at least one person in the house investigating.  Then on some ghosts it would be better to have 2 and 2 and other ghosts 1 inside and 3 outside (having to take turns who goes inside alone) and then 1 outside and 3 inside.  Having kept this game with a more grounded story would have created more interesting moments.  Also, if you scream to loudly, it should make the ghost come directly for you and be an almost certain death, that you could also use to your advantage by having people ready and drawing the ghost where you want so they can take it out.  I love the idea of the game, but I think this game is more of a stepping stone to better games to come.  I think it will seem pretty basic in a few more years, when someone nails the formula.  I'm allowing comments because I really want to hear other people's opinions in case I missed something, or so hopefully someone can persuade me this game has more value than I realize.  Seriously, please try to change my mind.  BUT I suffer from several counts of PTSD, and SEVERE depression.  So please, please, PLEASE BE KIND.  (why I can play horror games with PTSD and depression makes no sense, but for some reason it seems to help.  I have no idea why, but am thankful since I LOVE the horror genre so much)

This game is amazing! 

*BUT*

I wish there was a little more suspense to the game.

Such as:

- More Jump Scares
- More chases
- More random sounds (Footsteps, screaming, crying, talking, whisper, etc.)

I want more things that will get the player off of their feet and really question 
if they want to complete this or not.

The game is an overall great game! 
Just needs some more things added.

More places, Different style Ghost characters, etc.

If you can add stuff to get the player off of their feet more.
This game would be the best game ever.
Maybe even try adding in another mode where you can have more than 4 people :)

*ALSO*

You need to add in an Anti-cheat system. 

There are way to many people using cheats and it's honestly ruining the game.
For Example:

- People are giving themselves money instead of earning it.
- They spawn in and know what type of Ghost it is and where the room is located.
- People Make it to where the Ghost is not even allowed to hunt.
- Glitch through walls

These are just some suggestions that I have in mind and I hope in the future
the makers of this game take it into consideration. 

Thank you, 
Have a nice day :)

heres how the games go:

1. you and your friends load in, act like bodybuilders with HUGE pipelines in the van while looking at the whiteboard
2. you walk out of the van and make it to the front door, sadly realizing that out of the four of you, not a single person got the keys
3. you eventually find the room where the ghost is and you run back and forth chunking equipment into the room in question
4. the group decides one person should go in and find a specific piece of evidence even though everyone has the ability to go as well
5. someone dies and everyone laughs 
6. you find what ghost it is and call it a game
7. you find out that you somehow picked the wrong ghost even though getting all of the evidence pointing to that ghost
8. repeat

The part where this brilliant game full of bugs and ghosts... gets frustrating... is; When you are playing solo in public lobbies...  
Trying to find the exact lobby, can be very time consuming... and not worth your time.. Believe me!
I have a list of annoying things, that you might,- or might not encounter on your ghost-hunting journey!

*Selfish people, that dont want to include others.. (Usually premades, in public lobbies in a discord call)
*Rude people for no reason (Usually loud teens/kids/minors...
*No consideration when speaking native language in public lobby.. (You must either speak lobby language or leave)
*No attention to whats going on in the game... sits on social media...
*No listening to whats going on in game.. keeps asking same stupid question...
*Talking private stuff in van, instead of playing the game...
*Kicking people for no reason (usually muted lobby owners)
*Kicking people, because 1 joins, and want friend to join as well
*Kicking people, because u dont speak native lobby language
*No responding to found evidence etc..
*"Dude.... Go touch some grass"
*"OMG!?, Level 2.900!?!?"
*"OMG!?, You must be good with that high level"
*Playing with speakers! (hate hearing my own voice 2-3 times..)
*Playing with background noices! (Dogs, fans, screaming, tv-shows, music, Soundboard etc.)
*Idling in the van (Litterally AFK..)
*Scouting the house, while nothing to be found!
*Idling in the house, trying to get evidence, that isnt possible!
*Russians/Slovakians "Insists on not speaking english" 
*Russians/Ukrainians/Slovakians, flooding the european servers...
*80% Swedish people (Rude AF)
*Private games being hosted in Public lobby section..... 
*Premades using discord, but not ingame voice chat....
*European servers has 40-60% speaking or trying to speak english...Amazing...

[code][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/40987507-MidSeasonPro/] MSP Curator Page [/url] [/code]
[code][url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/MidSeasonPro/] Mid Season Pro Group [/url] [/code]

[b]Consider following our curator page if you are satisfied with this kind of review and join our group if you want to be part of us :).[/b]
 
[H1][B] Note that this review is for non-vr mode. [/B] [/H1]

Phasmophobia successfully constructed a setting centered on atmospheric horror, the game is very fulfilling in terms of atmosphere. This is the exact reason why psychological fear increases when there are jump scares present.

In Phasmophobia, you play as a ghost hunter who must explore different areas, use different tools to detect ghosts, and determine what kind of ghost you're dealing with. There are 10 maps available here to play and all of them contains similar ambience. They're somewhat creepy and you don't want to be alone in a room. The game doesn't rely on jump scares that much. It's more like psychological game. 

[H1] Story: [/H1]

Currently, there isn't much of a story in this game. However, the ghost you see contains lore.

[H1] Graphics: [/H1]

For and indie game, the graphics is really nice. Recent updates made it better and not really consuming. 


[H1] Audio [/H1]

This game's audio presentation is excellent; it skillfully heightens the suspense you experience. Ironically, you can hear soothing rain. Basically, the atmosphere and audio you hear vary based on where you are.

[H1] Gameplay: [/H1]

In Phasmophobia, you take on the role of a ghost hunter who must investigates various locations while using various equipment to spot ghosts and identify the type of ghost you're up against. Of course, identification should be backed up by evidence. You already have some tools. "Main equipment" and "optional equipment" are the two categories of tools. In order to survive the haunted location, you must make use of the eight key items in the game. It has a flashlight, camera, UV light, and other things. basically survival tools for seeing ghosts and paranormal activity. The second category is optional equipment, which includes 15 things in this tool. It will enable you to gather proof to support your claims, get a brighter flashlight, and carefully scout the area. There are a lot of tools here, but you don't have to utilize them all because they are situational. Depending on the type of ghost you're up against, several tools are handy. Of course, you'll need to buy your ghost hunting supplies; you can either do it all at once or simply some of it with your companions. To earn money, you need to do your job and finish the contract. Once you died, you can regain half/some of your items worth depending on the difficulty you play. "How do you prevent dying?" The sanity mechanics comes in. A parameter called sanity controls a variety of gameplay-related variables. Sanity is displayed as a percentage and starts at 100 at the beginning of a game before declining over time. The likelihood of a ghost carrying out particular deeds increases with decreasing average sanity.  It is inevitable that your sanity will decrease but you can recover it by taking a sanity pill. There are 10 playable maps here as of the moment, however they're all different in terms of the contracts they have. There are options for playing at either the amateur or intermediate level/difficulty. 


[H1] Controls [/H1]
It is simple to play the game using a keyboard and mouse. The game also fully supports controller. 

[H1] Pricing [/H1]
A full price of this indie game is worth it especially if you are a horror lover or you are playing with your friends.
