Phasmophobia is completely void of any character or fear factor. When first playing the game, the period of discovery and intrigue that comes with figuring out the ghost identification mechanics was quite fun but the game completely falls off after like 15 hours. There is simply no replay value for me, you load into a map then complete a set of chores. That's it, it's all there is to the game. There are genuinely no actual scares or threatening occurrences and the game hardly plays with the fact your hunting ghosts to scare you at all. Because of this, the game completely hinges on its gameplay to provide any entertainment value at all, and it's simply just not there. Map design specifically is awful, playing on any map above small is tedious, because it never changes ghost behaviour, it doesn't create a more involved experience like a larger map should, it literally makes you trudge through more rooms in order to find the one specific one the ghost is in. It's the only discernible gameplay difference between the small maps and the larger ones, and it doesn't offer a more in depth gameplay experience for those interested in what Phasmophobia has to offer, it simply makes you spend more time walking through uninhabited rooms and less time actually engaging with the game's main ghost identification mechanics (which aren't particularly fun themselves when you never feel any real danger or intimidation from any of the game's weak attempts at horror. To be frank: I don't even really hate Phasmophobia. It's fun for like... Two games. But for some reason this game has overwhelmingly positive review. Nearly everyone I know praises this game endlessly, it has a reputation online for being terrifying, and I just don't get it. It doesn't properly explore the idea of ghost hunting in an interesting or scary way (in my opinion, of course). Not to mention that presentation wise, the game is incredibly bland. I understand It's early access but this game really needs a face lift, it has really stiff animations (first person ones included), in terms of visual aesthetic the map's look like they could be from any indie horror game put together in unity and put on itch.io for free, same could be said for the majority of the ui (though I admit the journal is cool and feels neat in VR). I dunno, when compared to other contemporary co-op horror experiences like Devour, the game generally is quite boring to look at. It really does lack character. I hope through the continued support from the developers, Phasmophobia can become a more interesting horror experience. I'm still going to keep an eye on it: a ghost hunting game like this is a particularly unique idea that, given more time, could be explored much more thoroughly. Personally I'd just wait for this one to come out of early access, but who knows, you might enjoy it. I'm clearly in the minority here, everyone else seems to really love this game.

As it stands, you can experience everything the game has to offer in like 3 hours.

When you first start, you're thrown into a van with, hopefully, equipment on the left side of the van. On the right side there's a whiteboard with tasks and near the exit of the van a sanity graph. You can use certain tools like an emf reader or the thermometer to figure out what kind of ghost you're dealing with, which is another topic. Phasmophobia [i]does[/i] have voice-recognition which will be something you have to keep in mind. You can say phrases to possible provoke the entity you're dealing with, which is quite fun and new.

This game saved my life.

I am 36.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

Take zero to three friends (or strangers) with you to a steadily increasing variety of houses (and a campground!) and try to find out which of the steadily increasing types of ghosts is haunting it and murdering the inhabitants.

Honestly speaking, the world needs more spooky games that don't mash the jump scare button until it's broken, so this is a breath of fresh air. And by breath of fresh air, I mean incoherent screaming because our not-so-friendly neighbourhood ghost knocked over a mug like your typical cat. The update to the spirit box made me swear off the tool forever. That's what my friends are for.

In minus points, smudge sticks. Might need to be careful about your usage of native practices. And not all of the entities the game calls ghosts are actually ghosts if you look into their original lore.

That being said, Early Access so Things Are Yet To Come, excellent proximity chat, very solid voice recognition, and enjoyable gameplay.

I absolutely love this game! My family and I are always getting closer by ghost hunting together. We have had some real spooks and laughs. The only thing I would ask from the game creators is to add more unpredictableness (can this be a word)? I'm clocking about 100+ hours now and seeing the same full-bodied apparitions is becoming less scary and more routine. How about an unexpected whisper in the air to "leave" or a random shadow on the wall appearing for such a short time you weren't sure if you imagined it or not? Or perhaps even a glance of a figure in the mirror as you cross by it or random screams or crashes? New spirit box voices and more options of questions? It's the little things that I think we are missing here that would add to the whole spooky experience. I think it would make it more realistic, or at least as realistic as a ghost-hunting game can get!  I also can't wait to see Steam achievements become available for the game.

As much as I want to make this a joke comment about how the physics in this game works, I'll give it a proper review here.

Phasmophobia is a great 4 player investigation game that requires teamwork and cooperation in order to get the job done without any players left behind. I'll save you from the game summary, I'm sure you've seen a video on this game by now, so instead I'll jump straight into the opinions.

The idea behind this game is actually quite unique. I'm surprised I've never found a ghost identification game before, granted we mainly think of blasting them with lasers, or sucking them up with a vacuum. Being able to play with 4 people really changes the feel of them game, and is a catalyst for a surprising amount of fun memories. The game also has consistent production on it, making it able to be picked up and played as you please and still be able to play with new features. Now, it isn't updated daily per say, but every two or three months we get a pretty big update, the latest being known as the "VR Overhaul" update. I'm excited to see how this game grows and becomes stellar one day. 

Every game has its flaws, though granted this is what makes Phasmophobia Phasmophobia. The physics engine is notoriously buggy, allowing you to unhinge doors and sometimes find them missing when loading the map, only to find them floating outside. Biggest nit pick is it's genre. Technically speaking, this is a horror game. However, the fact you have 3 people experiencing everything with you at the same time, it very quickly loses that genre as it moves from "scary" to "mildly stressed". It still has plenty of frights your first few go-arounds, but after that it just becomes boring or comedic. I think it should be used as an introduction to new horror players personally. Ah, tangent, sorry. Where was I? Oh yeah. Breaking this door.

In the end, it's price is super worth it, especially if you can convince a group of friends to play with you. Even if you don't there are plenty of public lobbies for you to join as well! Worried about what you'll find online? They have a discord that has a large base of players looking for someone to join them! And if you want to be more horrified with nothing more than you and the ghost, there is a single player option too! Phasmophobia's got it all, and I highly recommend this game to anyone who wants the rush of being chased by a ghost, the IQ required to track the ghost down, and who wants to maybe not ruin a friendship over a video game for once. (Disclaimer: Friendship breaking results may vary. Play responsibly.)

Yeah, so me and my cousin got this game cause I saw people I knew playing it. We knew it was a scary game. When we loaded in we didn't know what to do at first so we screwed with each other closing doors, etc. . . Then we loaded into an "easy" mission we got the Moroi spirit, and lets just say wow. We were in a kitchen looking around when all of a sudden he see's a figure dash into the room and stand on the other side of the kitchen island. I didn't see it at first but when I did let's just say I had to change my shorts. Plus in the lobby, the garage there is also a jump scare which also scared me. So this game does a very good job in being scary, 10/10 would play again, but with other people, with two it's scary af. Also don't play in the dark unless you're built different.

This game is super fun to play with friends, and is a really fun scary experience. Phasmophobia is a game about hunting ghosts, but it isn't something like the ghost busters. Ghost busters can defend themselves. But in Phasmophobia, you only have to discover the type of ghost using evidence and gadgets you can buy. If the ghost starts hunting you, you just have to hide and hope for the best. Another thing I like about the game, is that they do not rely on cheap jumpscares to make you scared. Instead, the horror is in the tons of creepy/scary things the ghost does and the feeling of the darkness and being alone. The horror when I'm sitting in a corner with my friend's corpse on the floor 5 feet away from me, my emf reader blaring, hearing footsteps and floorboards creek as the ghost searches for me, is amazing. The game's graphics are quiete decent and I'm really exited to see what they do with it in the future.

Phasmophobia is the most fun I've ever had with a horror game. It's definitely not for you if you want an immersive story like Amnesia or something like Resident Evil or Silent Hill, etc. This game is a multiplayer-centric game played in randomized sessions in different houses (or sometimes schools, asylums, campgrounds etc.)

The ghost can be one of many different types, chosen at random, and it is your goal to try and determine what kind of ghost it is without dying, by using various tools to gather evidence and listening/tracking the ghost's location, while also having to hide at times when a "hunt" begins. The game is a lot of fun, especially with friends. If you've got a group of friends all ready for some virtual ghost-hunting, the Phasmophobia experience can't be beaten.

One of the best Multiplayer Horror Game for sure

TL;DR: Great horror/scary ghost hunting game. Still in Early Access but regularly updated. Worth my money.

Great game of investigation. Gather 2 to 3 hints to find out what type of ghost you are dealing with. With the ghost behaviour and by elimination of evidences, you can get by with only two to identify the ghost by guessing. But be careful, because the ghost could start a hunt to kill you (very scary btw). Very atmospheric, especially in VR (i rarely play desktop), VR is the way to play the game imo. If you have friends to play with, the better but there is a lot of public lobbies so you can find a group to undertake the medium and larger size maps easily. The devs are very active on updating their game, which is good. The game can seem a bit repetitive, having few small maps, a couple of med and one large, BUT the room which the ghost haunt and the hiding places to survive hunting phases change with each contracts. Looking for them at the start of the investigation is good practice. All in all, i am glad i bought the game, for the price tag, it is a no brainer if you are looking for a scary game of ghost hunting. 

Oh, also some would say that Ghost Excorsism Inc. is better than Phasmo. For having both, the big difference between the two games is that in Exorcism Inc., the ghost is like always in a hunting phase but is easily warded off with ghost defence items or simply by running to the Camping Car. In phasmo, it is very difficult to ward off the ghost in a hunting phase (i think only the smudge sticks are of any help) and the ghost locks up the entrances to the house, forcing you to hide and pray for the best to save your life. Choose your poison lol!

Also, take Pictures!! Ghost writings in the book, foot or hand prints, Ouija boards, cursed objects, even friends dead bodies. That is where you can make a lot of extra money in a contract.

 And don't forget to picture the bone evidence in each map and to take it. Easy money there.

This game, despite having a very repetitive gameplay loop, is just as fun each and every time you play it. It is wonderful for newcomers as well, since there are 24 ghosts, and more coming evetually, there are so many things you can see and learn on your first 5, 10, even 20 missions. The mechanics feel so fleshed out despite this game being early access, and the idea of a ghost hunting game where you can use your own microphone to ask questions or just coax the ghost out of hiding is genius. Definitely reccomend.

I love this game, and I don't even like most horror games!

This is a game that is best enjoyed with the lights turned way down, the volume turned way up and always in short bursts. I've found that after a few dozen rounds, I become desensitized to the scariness - so it's good to take long breaks. 

The game itself can be quite challenging, even when you understand the basics pretty well. Players have to deduce what type of ghost is haunting various spooky properties; often this is done by antagonizing the spirits in various ways and tracking their reactions. Coordinating with your teammates is key, especially on the tougher settings and larger maps!

I did not play this in VR, but based on what I've heard, playing in VR is a completely different and more terrifying experience!

A good game COMPLETELY screwed by terrible player controls:

1:This game highly rely on the player having a mic to communicate with your team and talk to the ghost. There are no chat box that you can type into. About %60 of the public rooms of this game are filled with like 10yo kids, crying and trolling or yelling over the mic once they join your room. Personally think this is the WORST part of the game because you can't expect what creatures are in your room,

2:Player kicking permission is completely GONE as soon as you start the game. Yes, that means not host-kicking, not vote-kicking and no "report" function. This game does require every player that is ALIVE to be inside the van(Spawn) to be able to end the game. Even the host can't leave everybody being ready. That means if anyone decided to afk outside the van(and not inside the hunted house which is where players can only be killed), everyone else's work is just wasted. Regardless of how many evidence you found, or how hard you try to find the ghost type, you must abandon the game without any reward. Or, stay inside with that afk forever. 

3:Game rooms are divided into "private" and "public" rooms. You can only invite your friends in private room which means no random people can join your room.  If you have 2 friends and are interested in playing a harder difficulties mode with 4 person to secure win, you can't do that with strangers. In the other hand, creating a public game will only allow strangers to join where you can't invite your friends.

Phasmophobia, the game that has changed everything for me. A game that introduced a new type of game that I love dearly. I have made so many new friends because of this game. But enough about me, onto the review!

This game brings so many things to the table, and plenty more to come. I got this when it was just 1 dev, and he did a great job. Now with a bigger team, they have changed this game completely with new content, maps, and are currently remaking Asylum, new main menu area, UI and ranks. Horror 2.0 soon to come and plenty of new maps and remakes to come as well. (hopefully) There are a good few bugs in this game, most being for the VR side, the bugs make the game an absolute blast sometimes!

With my current hours being at 509 hours, I can say that the jump scares are predicable a bit if you pay attention, but it can still give casual players a good fright! It is a good game to just absolutely chill and possibly drink with friends.

As this is a very small review, I highly suggest this game, on sale or not. I have high hopes for the future of this game and community!

Incredible potential but still a work in progress. The game is something completely new unlike anything I've played before. It is one of the few horror games to genuinely build tension and deliver scares and the mechanics can force players into tense decisions about whether it is worth the risk to return to the house to find that last piece of evidence or if your sanity is so low you might be attacked the second you set foot in the door.

The evidence gathering manages to be fun while still being similar from round to round and each mechanic does a good job of immersing the player in the game. At first nothing is creepier than getting a ghost to respond to you on spirit box saying he is right behind you.

However the imersion of the gameplay begins to wane after the first few levels acheived and the once imposing ghosts become more of a nuisance than a threat barring RNG giving you the 1 in 12 chance of picking the most dangerous ghost type. I hope more work can be done on this game to preserve the experience I had on my first hunt as a greenhorn ghost hunter unsure if any second an otherworldly being could end my existence. Perhaps more varied goals or unpredictable hunting behavior would force methodical veteran hunters to take risks or face the uncertainty that terrifies you when first playing this game.

I know I amassed quite some hours in this game, but I'm still going to leave it behind with a negative review. The reason for this is about the ratio of its popularity against its quality.

Right now, it's sitting close to 400,000 reviews with 97% of them being positive, awarding it the "Overwhelmingly Positive" status. However, the only reason this game got this far is because its popularity is owed almost exclusively thanks to Twitch and YouTube streamers, predominantly during Halloween. The actual game leaves a ton to be desired.

This game isn't better, more special or unique than any other in its genre. It's yet another paranormal activity/ghost "hunting" game in early access. It has glaring shortcomings, rough edges, rigid and stale gameplay, constantly changing rules (almost monthly at this point), ghosts hardly differ from one another, and so on and so forth.

Despite all of the successes that these streamers have brought the developers, with the influx of hundreds of thousands of players buying the game, the actual development of this game has been slow and not very impressive. Sure, the visual overhaul was nice and they are making some progress, but the game is still the same, plays the same and collects dust all the same. After a few games, all games are practically the same. Rush in, plop down your gear, run back and forth, determine the ghost, get killed randomly or escape. Even with some scaredy cat friends I've played this game with have moved past it because it's simply boring.

The only real reason people are still amassing hours in this game at all is because they enjoy playing it together. I can't imagine anyone playing this solo just for fun (streaming doesn't count). For that reason, you are better off looking for a game that stays engaging after the initial few games and doesn't rely on your buddies to not become dreadful.

Bottom line: the devs have received an unfathomable amount of revenue for this run-of-the-mill game but have barely managed to improve it. Maybe it wasn't meant to be improved that much beyond what it is right now. I'm sorry, but it feels like an alpha version or demo at best.

Out of all the games that could have gotten this much attention, it had to be this one. There are plenty better co-op experiences out there. This isn't it.

Incredible potential but still a work in progress. The game is something completely new unlike anything I've played before. It is one of the few horror games to genuinely build tension and deliver scares and the mechanics can force players into tense decisions about whether it is worth the risk to return to the house to find that last piece of evidence or if your sanity is so low you might be attacked the second you set foot in the door.

This game is getting regular updates, and the devs are great about providing updates that at least I think are sufficient. The different types of ghosts on the roster that are ever expanding keep the game from getting too boring imo, and they can be different enough in how they behave, which is fun. Heavy recommend to use the game chat, not discord as that separates you from the challenge of local/radio/dead chat. My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using his connections in the drug world. Connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Gustavo Fring, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling out. From what I can gather, Hank was always pushing for a greater share of the business, to which Fring flatly refused to give him, and things escalated. Fring was able to arrange, uh I guess I guess you call it a "hit" on my brother-in-law, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured, and I wound up paying his medical bills which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge, working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring, and did so. In fact, the bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen in the ranks to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA, and about that time, to keep me in line, he took my children from me. For 3 months he kept them. My wife, who up until that point, had no idea of my criminal activities, was horrified to learn what I had done, why Hank had taken our children. We were scared. I was in Hell, I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, to end this nightmare, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. I... All I could think to do was to make this video in hope that the world will finally see this man, for what he really is.

Has to be one of the best Indie games out there when played with friends. Fairly original and well produced concept that has many layers of complexity beyond what can be seen on the surface. The game is best played with friends, and as you learn some of the depth this game has to offer it becomes more enjoyable to play solo. The devs are active and interactive with their community, and seem to update the game frequently. Note: This game is essentially a puzzle game. This game is difficult for beginners, it takes a while to learn but once you do you'll begin seeking more challenges.

Additionally, I think this game would really benefit from a progression system that "unlocks" the hidden information in the in-game journal that is often required to solve the missions at higher difficulties. As it stands now you have to utilize 3rd party sources (or an ungodly amount of trial and error), like the wiki, to have a chance at solving the 'Nightmare' level missions; which, is where the game really gets to show off its depth and complexity.

This game is great, especially if you have a tight group you play with each time, you all figure out your roles and routines. 
A few things I think would make it more fun: 
At some point if you play a lot you end up with a lot of money and not a lot to spend it on unless you die and lose your equipment. I think there should be more unlockable content and customization. Like if you could buy new clothes and traits for your avatar, or different interiors for the truck (then whoever is hosting the game it would be their truck). 
I also think something needs to change with the larger maps. With only four people it's nearly impossible to play in the prison or school etc on harder levels cuz there's not enough time to really scout out the rooms without losing your sanity, and it takes too long to find a place to hide or to get out. There need to be some different advantages to these maps or new elements to make it more fun. 
There's some issue with the objective "escape a hunt". I'm pretty sure it's a matter of whether the ghost is choosing to hunt you vs a different player because we escape hunts all the time and it never checks off the objective. I think there's some technicality there that needs to be tweaked, its basically up to the ghost if we get it or not which makes it near impossible sometimes to get it. 

I'm excited for future updates, i think this is a great game that can only get better.

The Hog Rider is a fast ground troop with medium hit points, low damage, and the ability to jump over enemy Walls. He is unlocked at level 2 Dark Barracks.
The Hog Rider (person) is a bare-chested dark-skinned man holding a hammer. He has a Mohawk, wears a brown leather loincloth, a red belt, and a pair of leather sandals, as well as two large golden wristbands and a gold earring.
His ride is a large hog, about half his height. It has a brown leather bridle looped around its tusks, which in turn is held by the Hog Rider.
Hog Riders prioritize defensive structures above all other targets, and will bypass all other types of enemy buildings and troops while any defenses remain on the battlefield. This is true even if they are under attack by enemy Clan Castle troops, heroes or Skeleton Trap skeletons. Note that like all troops that prioritize defenses, Hog Riders do not consider the Clan Castle to be a defense regardless of whether or not it contains enemy troops, but do consider the defending Grand Warden and the activated Town Hall weapon (if any) to be defensive buildings. 
Once all defenses are destroyed, Hog Riders become like any other troop with no preferred target; they will attack the nearest building to them regardless of type, and will turn and attack enemy units if they become aware of any nearby.

A very interesting game with a unique dynamic gameplay loop of figuring out what ghost you are dealing with. The game is simple in that which you enter a building, usually a house, and start testing various areas for paranormal activities using ghost hunting gadgets, either brought in or available in the mystery machine. Each ghost have different strengths and weaknesses and unique abilities, such as a poltergeist tossing shit around, or a banshee hunting a specific target.

Usually co-op spooky games make the horror experience fall flat. However, Phasmophobia somehow makes it more scarier in groups. Its obviously made in Unity by one guy who appropriately uses assets as temporary placeholders, but delivers updates on such a high note. I would play it more but I have no friends and I can't handle the stress alone. For for some reason it makes me feel like I'm playing Clock Tower Ghost Head for the PS1.

This game is horrifying. I love it.

(TIP: If you find the Ouija Board you can say "Hide and Seek" and the ghost will make noises so you can easily find it! Great trick for new players.)

Ghost is in a room, you need to find it.
You can use various pieces of equipment, including EMF reader, Spirit Box, D.O.T.S. Projector, etc. 
The ghost will interact with three of these, giving you evidence for what type of ghost it is. 

(EX: if the ghost gives you EMF 5, Spirit Box, and D.O.T.S. then you know its a Wraith.)

Each ghost also has an ability, for example, the Wraith can fly, which won't give any footprints if it steps in salt.
When the ghost hunts you need to hide so that it doesn't kill you.

10/10 Game would recommend to everyone.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

a bit of advice i have for any new players:
because the game is still in early access as i write this, this is subject to change, but as of right now, there's some pretty important information about items and such in this game that the tutorial doesn't really tell you. don't worry; you can still start the game blind - the tutorial does give you a pretty decent gist of it, and you will naturally learn most things on your own, and have lots of fun doing so - but it will almost certainly be very helpful to read up on any objects or mechanics that come to confuse you, or that you can't seem to ever get to work. alternatively, if you find a good youtuber or streamer who is well-versed in the game, you could pick up some very helpful tips from them. maybe you could even learn from some high-level strangers in public lobbies! in any case, it's worth noting that there are some things you probably wouldn't think of or realize on your own.

This game can be simple or complicated, depending on how you're playing. At first, I was just having fun with my friends messing around with ghosts. It was a horror game, it honestly is super fun, how the concepts work with each other. It can be a very scary game. You can troll your friends, discover new cursed possessions, etc. Overtime, however, the game becomes less scary and I became better. I still get scared quite often, but calling it a horror game is disingenuous after you've played the game for a while. It has almost infinite repeatability. Learning about the ghosts and how the game works is fun too.

if you're feeling a little confused on how to play phasmophobia, allow me to post a short how-to;
just get 3 friends (and at the expense of their lives and hundreds of dollars of electrical, a/v equipment and other tools), go on a ghost hunt with literally no protection except a cross that weighs about 2lbs and a 'smudge' stick whatever the fuck that is. oh also lets get him to blow out the candle and step in some salt while we're at it. we'll call it 'evidence' even though it could have just been any fucking one of us running around like chickens with our heads cut off. now that we have our evidence, you can guess what ghost it was. oh sorry you were wrong, ya guessed spirit, but it was actually the Ghost of Christmas' Past from the 1843 novella A Christmas Carol. your friends are dead and you barely learnt a thing, oh well. you did make $5 tho!!!!!!!

This game is a lot of fun with friends. As of right now I have 193 hours in the game, and I've played through many updates of the game. I've heard from others that they get bored of the repetitiveness of the game, but I haven't had that problem. If you do have that problem, fret not because they're constantly adding updates to improve the game and introduce new content: new ghosts, new maps, new mechanics and more. It does occasionally have it's problems, as does any game that is receiving consistent updates, and one that I've had to deal with is my game randomly crashing, but they're quick to fix that problem when it arises. I would highly recommend this game.

Used to be a great game, but it seems with every update over the last year they continue to take out the features/bugs that truly made the game amazing, also none of the ghosts say it's Phasmophobian time over the spirit box before hunting, truly the greatest downfall in modern gaming.

the game is fantastic

Used to be great fun, (especially parkouring onto the counters and yelling at the ghost), but they have proceeded to suck every inkling of fun out of the game in trying to make a sweaty ghost hunter. It was simple great fun and now its a drag to play. I have great memories of friends running in circles around a couch during hunts as we are all laughing our asses off, but now the ghost is faster than you, no fun for you consumer. There is no way to fight back against the ghost in this game, (also the smudge stick fails like 80% of the time but who cares I guess.), so your only tool is hiding. But motherfucker, on higher difficulties, they REMOVE hiding spots. Its not enjoyable walking to a closet you used to hide in and screw around with the ouija board in and seeing that its full of shoe boxes now preventing you from accessing it.. OOoooOoo spooky fucking boxes. My friends and I can't seem to ever do more than one game before closing it anymore because its just boring. This game doesn't have exorcisms like the other games that came after this, or weapons like the salt shotgun or neutrino gun. So it needs to have that simple fun of hiding, and running away from the ghost on maps like high school as your friends laugh at you when you get caught on a locker then nuked. Cause other than that loop, there isn't much else to really do. If you play the game as intended, you will get maybe 4-10 hours of scares and fun which loses it's novelty very quickly. There is NOTHING to spend your money on, which completely nulls any incentive you may have to complete the mission because you buy more tools that you have 2549+ of already. Yay. Which is why making your own fun was such a huge component of replaytability. Well too bad, there is LITERALLY zero way to make your own fun anymore. You play the game as intended, find ghost, make 200 dollar, or die, repeat. Anything outside of that? Kys too much to ask for you greedy consumer. Things like the little bugs and parkour stuff was so fun. You could MAKE your own fun but there's no tools to do that anymore. They enjoy removing features like they did today where they decided to remove lighting a teammates smudge for some reason. Like okkkk? Just why lmao. Its such a small thing but they do self sabotaging shit like this all the time for no reason at all.  They spend a year to do any meaningful updates that aren't lighting fixes that no one cares about, then proceed to release shit like Willow Street House. I've never seen developers that had something so good and then just decide to take a hot dooky on it for no apparent reason. Ironically, the only time i saw people excited in their update section's comments, is when they posted the April Fools patch notes and people thought they were real features coming to the game. There were things like if there's the ghost pair, one of them would join your team and help hunt, emotes, 3 new maps, poltergeists throwing players, and other great ideas that were all just "jokes", despite being leagues ahead anything these creatures have produced in over a year and a half.  These stupid mongs joking about features is unironically what would make this shallow cum stain of a game actually fun again. But instead they go, "lol no sorry that was big funni, not real hahaha. Anyways here's a water texture fix in the sink no one noticed HEHhehHAhahheh." Ghost Exorcism Inc and Forewarned do it much better.

Also my homie joined these masochist's discord server and requested the old build of the game that was actually enjoyable and they banned him 💀, (and he asked once, he wasn't being annoying about it. Some youtubers were given access to the original build and posted videos a few months back so he was like, "they clearly have the old build, just give it to me. I'll even pay extra lmao." Comments on the videos were also expressing how they missed what the game used to be). These devs are incapable of taking criticism so instead they just remove more content and add more lighting changes. YAY! YAY! YAY! 

I made this review because seeing the teammate smudge stick thing kinda put the nail in the coffin for my hopes with this pile of doo doo. Its not a huge change on its own, but its par for the course with their constant removal of features, and with how this game will progress going forward. There just is not enough content for them to be removing anything. You don't get to remove 20,000 things then release fucking Willow Street House or the Campsite lmao. Plus this game REALLLY deserves that overwhelmingly positive review score to go down. It used to deserve it, but not for over at least a year and then some.

Seriously though, for indie devs that we used to love supporting, your heads have really shot far up your own asses now. Dickwads

This game is nothing short of a great time to play, either solo or with friends (though I will say playing with friends is the optimal way to experience it). Genuine scares and dynamic game play make this title one that rarely feels stale or stagnant. While the real-life TV show counterparts to ghost hunting may paint a ridiculous feeling on its premise, this game is a real thrill to get into with investigations, problem solving, and truly heart-thumping chases (which can be fatal scenarios). 

It's impressive how much love & attention to detail this game gets from its developers; they've come a long way from the start in terms of graphical & mechanical quality! Today, the overall atmosphere is stunning due to updated visual quality, terrifying new sounds, and pretty interesting options to interact with the in-game world. 

If Phasmophobia has come this far in progressing its quality, there's only good things ahead as the developers regularly add new content and fix existing content. I'll be sticking with this title for as long as it is available!!

I love new maps, and love the truck overhaul update and everything that has been coming out; it's all amazing. The only issue, is that the gameplay has felt static and unchanged for a VERY long time, even with the release of DOTS and new ghosts. It practically feels the same every game, where you yell into the spirit box until the ghost finally says something, or you wait for 10 minutes for the ghost to finally write in the book, or you get a ghost thats TOO easy that has like fingerprints and ghost orbs as evidence and you solve it in 2 seconds. The ghosts are all really easy to find out and you can expand on the gameplay by doing your own personal challenges like the youtuber Insym does, but the fact that there is no workshop or modding capability in the game is really a HUGE let down to the community. You shouldn't have to alter how you play the game for yourself after only a couple hours of playing just because the gameplay is so static and boring. This game is very fun to begin with, but fair warning to all newcomers - after a couple hours, you will become bored very fast. Hopefully some game mechanics are changed or there becomes a workshop capability for people wanting to play the game, because it has so much potential but falls very flat with the gameplay. No shade to the developers, because the recent updates have been extremely necessary and have provided some good bug fixes and quality of life changes, but I don't see the game continuing to grow and progress in the future due to the bland nature of the game. Anyone that watches Insym should be wary, as he claims the game is fun and is in no need of these changes and sides with the developers a lot. I love the guy, but his almost 2000 hours in the game has blinded him from the true faults of the gameplay, because he's truly in love with the game. So be careful y'all! Do I recommend the game? Yes. On sale? Definitely. Will you get bored after a day or two of playing? Absolutely. Have fun guys!

Phasmophobia is almost everything you could ask for in a horror game. A lot of elements in this game work together to create a very dynamic experience. The wide variety of ghost hunting equipment all play a solid role throughout any level. This game delivers when it comes to a horrifying, intense, and unpredictable environment. On the contrary, I wish there were more story elements added to this game; ie: diaries, crime scene evidence, newspapers that associate with the deceased individual you're investigating, etc. Without these few elements, I personally believe I'm not really serving a sole purpose on why I'm investigating a particular ghost in the first place besides rewards you receive from the contracts you accept. That isn't considered to be a bad thing, but it definitely adds more depth to this game if Kinetic Games were to acknowledge that and update it in the foreseeable future. I did enjoy the multitude of levels in this game, a lot of them were very unique in their own respected ways and they're not too complex in design (besides Asylum).  I highly recommend this game for anyone searching for a unique, but terrifying experience either playing solo or with a couple of friends.

Phasmophobia has a lot going for it and even more so that it's being consistently updated by the developers, especially since the big updates always include new ghosts, improved systems, and so on. Each time there's a new update there's also a lot to learn/relearn as they do tend to change up how equipment is used. However, Phasmophobia is a game that deals with a lot of detective work, and a lot of hustle. You'll be expected to spend quite some time in the professional and nightmare modes trying to figure out what signs the ghost is giving (which can be time consuming) and you may not even get an answer. It's a game that I wouldn't call horror, but more a coop detective piece with the supernatural being the main driving force.

TLDR: It's good, it takes time, it's not that scary but it is fun.

There was a time when this game used to be fun. It was easier in terms of the signs used to find which type of ghost you were dealing with, and the overall difficulty of the ghost was easier. Now, there are far too many ghost variants, and the hunting period has gotten a lot harder. I'm sure to some this was a welcomed addition, but for myself and my group of friends, it made the game almost unplayable. You can now get hunted through doors, attacked while in hiding spots etc. I personally think they've ruined this game and made it substantially more "sweaty" just to complete missions, hence why we have all given up on it. Devour is a better game for the money, more fun to complete missions with, and overall just better mechanically.

Where do I start with this piece of fuck.

The community is fucking trash and toxic as hell if you're joining public games. YOU WILL NOT BE ABLE TO ENJOY THIS GAMES WITHOUT FRIENDS OR JOINING THE PHASMOPHOBIA DISCORD LFG.

The ghosts literally fuck you in the ass. The gameplay design is such that you and your team will be delving into the unknown where, on the harder (proper) difficulties, you could either end up with a harmless ghost or a crawling hell demon that slaughters your co-investigators on first contact. The ghosts in this game are fucking scary. The amount of variation both in models, visibility (ie some may only be visible by placing salt on the ground and having them walk through it, some may only appear for a split second through video cameras while hunting, some may only appear as ghost orbs, some may talk to you. These fuckers have utterly no limit in variety and villainy.

When I first played this game there were about 8 ghosts, some small amount like that. Now we're on 24. TWENTY-FOUR. And that is just ghost-type. Within those types (ie the hell demon or pussy-clad ghost) they will inevitably have different models and interact differently with the environment. Every new job you do in this game feels new and fresh. Phasmophobia is a moist, lubricated cock ready to fuck you right up in your asshole, and the correct response to that is "excellent, my asshole is ready".

I recommend Phasmophobia to any and all degenerates who can suspend their disbelief that ghosts could exist.

I used to like this game a lot, and I really wish I could still like it. But quite a few things stick out to me, 

1. The game isn't even the slightest scary, I'm sorry but it truly doesn't deserve the "horror" tag. I have yet to even be startled. 

2. The game sometimes takes absolutely forever to give you hints on where the ghost is or what it is. Sometimes taking upwards of 35-45 minutes. Really Really REALLY boring. 

3.  Hunts are poorly designed and end up being more frustrating then fun. Your ghost hunter must never exercise in the slightest, and I get it, the houses can be small and a big sprint pool is bad, but it makes it way more obnoxious to run away from the ghost. I'm tired of losing my stuff because my guy can't just jog a little faster. Not to mention you lose all your stuff and if you play on the harder difficulties, means you lose all your money and now, since you probably need to rebuy equipment, means in the next case you might be unable to complete challenges resulting in you earning less money.  

Putting this all into something tangible, you effectively get a game that is marketed as scary or at the very least suspenseful (which the first few times you play it very well is) and then it quickly erodes into a boring "Clue" game where the evidence is drip fed at a snails pace. And when you finally get your last piece of evidence, you get into a hunt where your hunter can't even hide. Lame. 

Overall, I usually only play this with friends because to be honest, its fun to just hangout and do this on the side. Wish the devs would make the game a little more fun and a lot spookier and anyone who says "BuT JUmPsCaReS ArE CHeaP!!!111!!!" I'm not asking for that, I'm simply asking for gameplay that feels actually terrifying. 

Maybe you look out the window and see the ghost staring back and an audio cue, maybe a mirror. Maybe little things like the door you are entering opens automatically for you. Maybe the flashlight flickers a tiny bit just to mess with you. Maybe there is writing in a mirror or a loud bang of furniture being moved. Or the sounds of a voice crying or yelling. And please, overhaul the journal, there are so many things you need to google to just figure out. Like, Wraiths cannot leave footprints but apparently can touch salt and leave a footprint? Huh??? And you'd need to google it and even the couple top results don't answer your question.

This game has potential to merge both the case solving and horror ghost game it was meant to be, but instead we get a dry-rot version of a "horror" game, a horror game with the foundation there but the true meat of the experience withered away.

Graphics and detail: Good (can make it better in settings).

Gameplay: Amazing.

Computer required: Good.

Story: none.

Creativity: Amazing.

Physics: Good enough to be good.

Scariness (1 to 10): 7 or higher for starters, 5 or higher for experienced players.

Tutorial: no, but there is training mode. I personally recommend watching videos.

Difficulty: selective difficulty. moderately easy to learn.

Update activity: often updates the game. including major ones.

Overall: 8.5/10.

It's amazing how well this game works. Calling out a ghost's name, the lights go out, and in a flash you catch a glimpse of it standing just a few feet away... Absolutely incredible. The learning curve on this game can be steep if you want to get really good at it, but for the casual spooky shenanigans with friends this game will more than satisfy even with only the basics under your belt. If you're the type who wants to play by yourself then have no fear (ok, maybe a healthy amount of fear for these ghosts) because there's a single player mode that gives you the same experience alone. 

Are there some rough edges? Yeah, maybe a few. But if you want to feel the tension ratchet up and suddenly jump out of your seat from ghostly surprises, this is the game for you.

I love this game. (Understatement). I simply cannot get enough of it. I go to sleep and I dream about Phasmophobia. I wake up and I think about Phasmophobia all day every day. I am afraid that I'm either going to become an adrenaline addict or fry my own amygdala. Maybe both, who knows. Oh goody, so worth it! The ambiance of this game is dang near perfect- I hear so many of the creepy sounds throughout my everyday life causing me to daydream more about it. Honestly that part feels a bit unfair. I can't sit in a squeaky chair without going into fantasy horror ghost land. I also tend to be a bit more jumpy around the house when someone surprises me around a corner, or my cat is hiding my closet. Phas seriously has made my life more fun and exciting in a lot of ways outside of gameplay. I listened to the Ghostbusters theme song 5 times yesterday before 11 AM. I ain't afraid of no ghost! >:o 

While my fears of becoming an actual adrenaline addict and frying my fight-or-flight response are very real- in the case that my house is ever haunted, I feel that I would be able to handle the situation with more ease and less sheer panic after diving headfirst into this game. I also have only played solo or with one other person, which I now realize is not the most popular way to play this game. It may be terrifying to play solo, but you really only rely on yourself/have all equipment available to you at all times. It's also kind of a birch tree to walk back and forth to the van on your lonesome constantly with those pesky 3 inventory slots. BUT! Sanity drainage is a lot slower, and I feel that I get hunted less/can complete all objectives much faster while playing solo. I also might be a glutton for pain, so take my advice with a grain of salt. All I'm saying is that I never died playing solo. *Shrugs*

I hope that I don't get tired of this game, it truly is one of the most unique experiences I've had while playing video games. Actually, it's one of the most unique experiences when it comes to horror that I've ever had- and I'll just say that nothing does it for me anymore- but THIS GAME DOES. Over and over and over again. Maybe if I get tired of playing this on my PC, I'll opt for VR and experience this game the way it should be (probably 100x more terrifying). A+++++++. Thank you Devs :'-)

[b]TL:DR -Phasmophobia is just an all around great game, it defined a new genre for scary games that is a winning formula.[/b] 

I am level 1212 currently with 302 hours, and can honestly say that while you get used to the jump scares and such, the most fun part of this game is teaching people that are new to the game, letting them make the same mistakes that you did until they ask you a question where you can give the insight that you have gained over your play time.

[b][u]Some pro's for this game:[/b][/u]
-Fun gameplay that you can play with friends up to 4 players. (my sweet spot is 2 players)
-A variety of maps
-Many ghosts (doubled since release)
-Active Developers that care about their game and the vision that they have for it.
-Difficulty levels for those who want the hardcore experience, or there is also a noob friendly difficulty.

[b][u]Some Cons:[/b][/u]
-The Developers have a vision that I can respect, but I always hoped they would add Steam Workshop support, which they have actively said they will not. I respect their decision but feel that the maps and ghosts the community could add would make this game immortal like gmod.
-When you have 4 experienced ghost hunters, you tend to find the ghost out very quickly with little to no danger to yourselves.
-The game can get a little boring or even a little annoying on some of the bigger maps just looking for the ghost for 10 minutes.

[b][u]Additional Comments:[/b][/u]
-You can spice up gameplay by limiting yourself and ally's, such as trying no evidence runs, or trying to get all of your equipment back to the van before leaving.
-The ghosts they have been adding have all had really cool abilities and unique gameplay. Although some ghosts could use an update such as the Spirit which doesnt have any strong ability only a negative ability.

Overall with 302 hours I would definitely recommend this game with a 9/10 score.

Game is ok, community is toxic as hell. If you're not getting your ears raped by a 10 year old using a stupid robot voice, you're having to listen to mysogynistic assholes latch on to anyone with a female sounding voice demanding to know their age and location and wanting to send dick pics. It's a shame because when playing with a full group of socially funtional adults this game is great. Apparently the problem is that this game mainly attracts the "yelling racist and homophobic insults at the imaginary ghosts" demographic.

Finding a lobby worth staying in is a mini-game all by itself. You have AFK hosts, TTV yaks who play solo but create an MP lobby to do it, people who are waiting for their friends but instead of using a private lobby decide to be a-holes and use public, lobbies created purely for the purpose of being used as a voice chat room, lobbies where everyone else is on Discord and refuses to use the in-game voice, lobbies full of 10-year old trolls who deliberately get their team killed...

If you want to play "Find a decent lobby simulator" this game is 100% for you. If you want to actually play Phasmaphobia, just wander around your house with the lights turned off and have a friend whisper creepy things to you in the dark. It's cheaper and easier.

95% of the game is dialogue with other npcs and yourself. So if you don't want to read for 30+ hours this is not the game for you. There is absolutely no combat. The RPG aspect is that you can level up different aspects of yourself like logic, reaction time, composure, endurance, etc. and as those skills come up in conversation you are having not only dialogue with the npcs but also yourself on how to proceed. It is very unique, and very awesome if you are into it. One of the most unique, thought provoking games I've ever played.

Vintage chocolate chip cookies

Ingredients
150g salted butter, softened
80g light brown muscovado sugar
80g granulated sugar
2 tsp vanilla extract
1 large egg
225g plain flour
½ tsp bicarbonate of soda
¼ tsp salt
200g plain chocolate chips or chunks
Method
STEP 1
Heat the oven to 190C/fan170C/gas 5 and line two baking sheets with non-stick baking paper.

STEP 2
Put 150g softened salted butter, 80g light brown muscovado sugar and 80g granulated sugar into a bowl and beat until creamy.

STEP 3
Beat in 2 tsp vanilla extract and 1 large egg.

STEP 4
Sift 225g plain flour, ½ tsp bicarbonate of soda and ¼ tsp salt into the bowl and mix it in with a wooden spoon.

STEP 5
Add 200g plain chocolate chips or chunks and stir well.

STEP 6
Use a teaspoon to make small scoops of the mixture, spacing them well apart on the baking trays. This mixture should make about 30 cookies.

STEP 7
Bake for 8–10 mins until they are light brown on the edges and still slightly soft in the centre if you press them.

STEP 8
Leave on the tray for a couple of mins to set and then lift onto a cooling rack.

RECIPE TIPS
FREEZING THE BISCUITS
If you’ve frozen the biscuits, take them out and arrange them on a lined baking sheet. Once defrosted, pop them in a medium oven 190C/170 fan/gas mark 5 and heat for 2-3 mins to crisp up. Don’t leave them too long or they’ll dry out.
STORING DOUGH
You can keep the uncooked dough in a sealed container in the fridge for up to two weeks. Simply take some out, dollop on a lined baking tray and allow to come up to room temperature for 5 mins before baking

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Rating: Scary game and cool concept but very empty 6/10

I'm writing this review to people like myself who saw the user reviews and thought "Wow, this game must be amazing". I think it gets good reviews because people like the concept, that it's scary, that they can play with friends and that it's supposedly developed by 1 person (props to him/her). I also really like the concept, and I enjoyed the first hours of playing the game, but it didn't take long before I realized I had already experienced all that the game had to offer, or that I saw through the mechanics and learned how to exploit them. 

After playing 1 level you have basically played all the levels. The maps gets bigger, but they are all extremely empty and there's very few things you can interact with. Your character walks extremely slow, and there's almost no difference in speed between walking and sprinting. It feels like 90% of the action happening are the lights going out, and you having to find the power generator to turn it back on. 

I've played the game with different groups of people, and most of them have struggled with the interface and controls which feels weird and clunky. Two of them didn't even get to play the game because of a bug that wouldn't let the game accept their mic input.

However I think 10$ for a couple of hours of fun is worth it, so I would encourage people to buy it and try it out, but I wouldn't really recommend it after that.

Now I don’t really have much to complain about this game because I’ve been playing it since like January of 2021, but I have some ideas that I hope you could take into consideration. Now I won’t be surprised if the twins, mimic, onryo, and raiju will be the last new ghosts, but if they aren’t, I have one that I would like to consider adding to the game. And that is a gwisin, which means spirit/ghost in Korean. Gwinsin’s in Korean culture have already been known to drain peoples sanity and posses the living, so that can already be an advantage with the gwisin being able to drain sanity in the game. And for evidence, maybe like spirit box, fingerprints, and dots if that’s a possible combination of evidence, but I think you should at least have spirit box. BUT gwinsin’s are unable to see, BUT it can move even faster than revenant’s and raiju’s and can also hear incredibly well, like can even hear your footsteps from really far away and can hear you close doors. And they can also sense if you’re near too, so standing still won’t work because then the ghost will be essentially useless if it was unable to do that. Now for maps, I had like 2 or 3 ideas. I think for one you should do an elementary or middle school, now I know you guys have brownstone, but I think another medium size map would be nice with like an elementary school, and even something like a playground could count as a ghost room. Another idea for a map and I know it sounds stupid, but a restaurant or diner. There wouldn’t be a lot of possible ghosts rooms other than the kitchen, storage closet, bathroom, and dining area, but maybe. Another idea for me would be an amusement park. I know all these ideas sound crazy and it would be too much to explore, but I was thinking it could be big like maple lodge and have a Ferris wheel and carousel and games and stuff. These are all just suggestions though. You don’t have to take any of these ideas, but if you see this review, could you please maybe take consideration for any of these ideas? But anyways, love this game, love everything about it. 5 stars

I am a 46 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 15 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 32 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

This is an awesome game, especially playing with others. It has a lot of parallels with real ghost hunting, especially the equipment. I like how it doesn't have a large convoluted story like other horror games I have played. It has a bunch of smaller frights instead of one large jumpscare too, so I feel less hesitant to play the game, as I don't worry about being completely terrified when I die to the point of turning the game off. There is also evidence and deduction gameplay to figure out the type of ghost that round. 9/10 if you are by yourself, 10/10 with others.

Сделать страшную игру очень сложно, а сделать страшную совместную игру практически невозможно. Но "Phasmophobia", разработанная всего одним человеком, находится на пути к тому, чтобы стать одним из лучших страшных многопользовательских игр всех времен. Как это уже не раз случалось в последние годы, независимая разработка игр показала, что вам не нужны бесконечные деньги и сотни людей, чтобы сделать запоминающийся титул. С хорошей идеей, большим творчеством и большим упорством, все еще можно создать отличную игру.
Phasmophobia - это игра ужасов с совместным режимом до четырех игроков, в которой цель состоит в том, чтобы исследовать место с привидениями. Эта игра использует гораздо более сдержанный и мрачный подход. Как только вы прибудете на место своей миссии в своем грузовике, который удваивается как командный мост, вам скоро будет дана ваша миссия: ваша основная миссия всегда состоит в том, чтобы определить, с каким призраком вы имеете дело, и вам также будут даны три случайно сгенерированные цели для выполнения.
И без того подавляющая атмосфера в первые несколько часов хождения только усиливается тем фактом, что мы действительно не знаем, что, черт возьми, мы должны делать. Мы получим и позже используем деньги, которые зарабатываем на выполнении миссий, чтобы купить оборудование, которые мы можем использовать, чтобы предположительно связаться с потусторонним существом, а также большое количество вспомогательных и домашних практик (соль!) для отслеживания его перемещений. Однако нам придется выяснить, как они работают, с некоторой помощью из наших заметок, которые могут быть вызваны в любое время. В противном случае мы сможем узнать о различных типах призраков и их поведении, а также выполнить нашу главную задачу здесь.
В первые несколько часов вам следует ожидать высокого сердечного ритма и нескольких страшных моментов, так как вы будете чувствовать себя потерянным среди случайных призраков, неизвестных путей и средств, а миссии не раз заканчиваются смертью. Тем не менее, Я бы определенно рекомендовал попытаться разобраться в игре самостоятельно, и только в крайнем случае за помощью извне. Одной из основных сущностей игры является знакомство с особенностями и картами, и даже самые страшные моменты связаны с ними, поэтому это может нанести ущерб опыту, если вы отправитесь в приключение полностью подготовленным.
Phasmophobia - это в основном приключенческая детективная игра на тему ужасов, где вам предстоит разгадать ту же загадку о том, с каким призраком вы имеете дело, основываясь на собранных вами уликах. Поскольку это довольно случайно, и существует довольно много типов призраков, поскольку обстоятельства всегда меняются. Искусственный интеллект призраков хорошо написан, так как они действительно ведут себя беспорядочно и имеют в своем репертуаре немало страшных сюрпризов. Помимо глушения света и вмешательства в объекты, они могут напугать людей с более слабыми нервами, просто случайно появляясь, но они также могут вызвать некоторые отчетливо запоминающиеся моменты с использованием объектов взаимодействия.
Я определенно должен упомянуть распознавание голоса в качестве основной функции игры. Phasmophobia слушает вас все время, пока вы играете, и вам, безусловно, нужно будет общаться с загробной жизнью, чтобы вызвать некоторых призраков. Вы даже можете получить ответы на свои вопросы, поговорив по радио, что может создать несколько удивительно захватывающих ситуаций. Это может быть довольно парализующим, когда, после долгой попытки ответить на вопрос "Где ты?", монотонный мужской голос по радио отвечает "За тобой!", сидя на корточках в темной детской комнате (с пугающем до ужаса медведем). Именно такие моменты делают атмосферу по-настоящему потрясающим, а ее уникальные особенности надолго запомнят эти моменты. Темперамент потусторонних персонажей в игре сильно варьируется, поэтому вы можете столкнуться с атакующим призраком почти сразу, но вы также можете завершить миссию без каких-либо серьезных упырей. Поскольку оружия нет, то от ужаса стоит спрятаться
Phasmophobia в настоящее время доступна в раннем доступе, но если вы немного поклонник ужасов и у вас есть несколько храбрых друзей, это определенно стоит попробовать. Как я уже писал выше, первоначальный хаос многое добавляет к опыту, поэтому после 15-20 часов игры, как только вы отработаете уникальные фишки, название становится менее пугающим.

An Average Phasmophobia round:

P1: "Where is the Ghost Room?"
P2: "I dunno. Did we check the basement yet?"
P3: "Found it! It's the Kid's Bedroom, we got negative temps. Drop the book"
P1: "I don't have the book, P4 does"
P4: *standing there with the Spirit Box in hand* "Are you there? What's your name? I don't have the book, P2 does, he grabbed it right before round start"
P2: "Oh I do" *drops book*
P4: "Can you show us a sign? *light turns off and book has writing* Well, let's get the fuck out of here-"

THE HUNT HAS BEGUN

P1 Dies, everyone else runs, trying not to curse so they don't start another hunt.

10/10 - You'll kill your friends because you forget that the ghost doesn't like you cursing.

I recommend this game! it is extremely fun to play, especially with friends!
it can be intense; hiding, running and cowering in the corner as you're being hunted- but finding evidence and the ghosts' room is extremely satisfying!
There are, however, moments where the player can get frustrated- such as low stamina and a fast ghost or a player with low sanity and a ghost that constantly goes on the hunt the moment the player walks in.
To me, there are alot more pros than cons with this game!
but of course YOU will have to play to decide!

I am a 40 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 13 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.I am a 40 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. PROS:
Excellent game with tons of replayability
Top tier Co-op horror game (Team of 4)
Lots of ghost diversity, Lots of Items
Fun for casuals with massive skill ceiling
Excellent Ghost AI 
Great Dev team with regular updates
9.5/10 horror strategy game, highly recommend 

CONS:
Takes time to learn ghosts, items, objectives. SLOW TO START
You never exorcise the ghosts, the entire game is about Identifying them
Map pool can get old (about 10 maps)
Needs more jump scares and death animations
Should be a difficult easter egg to exorcise the ghost (similar to killing Jason in Friday the 13th)

OVERALL:
Excellent game, highly recommend.
Horror Co-op game fans will love this game, comparable to Friday the 13th and Dead by Daylight
Updated regularly with a competent Dev team
Greatly programmed AI playing the ghost
Horror Mystery Strategy game
Please add a way to exorcise the ghost for experienced players, also a double barrel shotgun that shoots salt to stun the ghost or reset it would be sweet, food for thought !
Buy this game.

The community has something against new players who are just looking for fun and/or want to grow with the community. As much as I wanted to have this game in my library, I doubt I'll use it that much after experiencing the first 5 hours more on getting kicked out. Single-player isn't as fun as playing with other people, but wasting hours of waiting just to get kicked out of the public lobby every time just because I'm new is not really fun.

Game is great, not gonna lie. If you have friends who have access with the game, play on private and have fun. You might meet some awesome players in the public lobbies, but you are more likely to meet screeching microphone trolls, and people who have prejudice against new players in there (if you are new). 

TLDR: Game is a 10! Don't expect anything from public lobbies though. Go private and play with friends.

I like everything about this game and I almost missed out on all it's glory due to me being stubborn and not listening to the many recommendations to play from my friends. Seriously play Phasmaphobia and explore every nook and cranny you can. The huge variety of Ghosts, Spirits and Entities in this game alone are impressive but the teamwork and investigation aspect are so strong and enjoyable that you will be hooked instantly. Terrific scares, objectives to complete and impressive equipment to utilize. Every game is different and every challenge is unique & fun. Play this game if you like horror thriller environments, teamwork and jump scares. HUGE RECOMMEND!!

It's one of the better games on steam. It's well designed and can be a lot of fun when you can get into it. the only issue I have is the lack of maps. There are 10 maps, the 6 small ones are a ton of fun and don't ever get boring. the school and the prison sometimes can be pretty boring if the ghost isn't all that active. And my friends and I refuse to play on asylum, it's just too big. Campgrounds is a map that I don't really play all that often so I can't really have a valid opinion on it. The ghost themselves are a ton of fun and My group tries to play Phasmophobia at least once a week fore a few hours.

If you liked Paranormal Activity cuz it made you shit your pants, you will absolutely love this game. You have to detect the type of ghost, not hunt it, trap it or kill it. Meantime, the ghost can fuck with you, and even go as far as to kill you if you're not careful. Amazing game bound to make you shit yourself or close enough to do so! I loved how life-like the graphics are and the game mechanics. I have had no problems with running the software for the game. This game gives me such an adreline rush

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

absolutely amazing and terrifying game, either alone, with friends, or with randos. the ambience in the game is horrifying, and ghost events/hunts are some of the scariest shit i've experienced. the investigation aspect of the game is amazing, and trying to deduce what kind of ghost you're dealing with is extremely fun, especially when evidence is hard to come by so you try to identify ghosts based on their special/hidden abilities or strengths/weaknesses.

the devs do a FANTASTIC job at updating the game and keeping it interesting with new content and overhauls, as well. literally can't wait for the game to get out of early access. this game deserves all the love and praise it gets, and i hope it pops off like crazy again whenever it does come out of early access.
