I love this game so much! It is so much fun, and it will get your heart pounding lots of times. I love playing with other people but I have that there is one problem (other than a couple bugs here and there) with playing with others and it's not even the game devs fault.
If your a new player, and you join a random public lobby, 9 times out of 10 you will end up kicked for the simple fact your new. I'd love it if the game devs could do something about this, like maybe putting something where you can but tags on your public lobby and one of them be like noobs welcomed, plus adding tags will allow you to know what kind of lobby your getting into like if there doing easy or hard mod and so forth. (Just a little suggestion to make the game even better)
Even without this added to the game I would still give the game a 9/10

One of the best in the horror game category. But the level of fear is not so much. You can have a great time with your friends. It can be played alone, but when you die, the items you get are gone. So it makes more sense to play with friends. It would be more logical to play with one or two people buying a lot of items and the other two people risking more. Even if two people in the stake die, the total property damage will be less and they can help you finish the game even when dead. Having different maps is very nice and increases the playing quality. It looks like there is some optimization issue. Still not much of a problem. It's just that the mechanics seem simple and unrealistic to me. Especially the feeling and voice of walking is very fake. Fatigue time feels very short and a bit frustrating. Other than that, it's a really great game, I would recommend it to anyone.

Old Fashioned Pumpkin Pie

2 large eggs
1 large egg yolk
1/2 cup packed dark brown sugar
1/3 cup white sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 teaspoons cinnamon
1 teaspoon ground ginger
1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
1/4 teaspoon ground cloves
1/8 teaspoon cardamom
1/2 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest
2 cups pumpkin purée from a sugar pumpkin (see Recipe Note) OR 1 (15-ounce can) pumpkin purée (can also use puréed cooked butternut squash)
1 1/2 cups heavy cream or 1 (12-ounce) can evaporated milk
1 homemade pie crust, chilled or frozen (see pâte brisée recipe or our no-fail flaky pie crust recipe), or 2 pre-made pie shells

Preheat the oven:
Preheat your oven to 425°F.
Make the filling:
Beat the eggs in a large bowl. Mix in the brown sugar, white sugar, salt, spices — cinnamon, ground ginger, nutmeg, ground cloves, cardamom, and lemon zest.
Mix in the pumpkin purée. Stir in the cream. Beat together until everything is well mixed.
mixing pumpkin pie ingredients
pumpkin pie ingredients mixed well
adding cream to pumpkin pie puree
pumpkin pie filling ready to add to pie
Fill the pie shell and bake:
Pour the filling into an uncooked chilled or frozen pie shell. Bake at a high temperature of 425°F for 15 minutes.
Then after 15 minutes, lower the temperature to 350°F. Bake for 45 to 55 minutes more. The pie is done when a knife tip inserted in the center comes out wet but relatively clean. The center should be just barely jiggly.
(About half-way through the baking, you may want to put foil around the edges or use a pie protector to keep the crust from getting too browned.)
Note that the pumpkin pie will come out of the oven all puffed up (from the leavening of the eggs), and will deflate as it cools.
pumpkin pie in dish ready for baking
Baked Pumpkin Pie From Scratch
Cool the pie on a rack, then serve:
Cool the pumpkin pie on a wire rack for 2 hours.
Serve with whipped cream.

Fajna gra ale bez bigosu się nie obejdzie
SKŁADNIKI:
500 g mięsa wieprzowego (np. karkówki)
200 g kiełbasy
1 cebula
2 łyżki oleju roślinnego
3 szklanki bulionu lub wody
30 g suszonych borowików
2 łyżki powideł śliwkowych lub kilka suszonych śliwek
1 jabłko (np. reneta lub antonówka) - opcjonalnie
1 kg kiszonej kapusty
1 łyżka koncentratu pomidorowego
1 łyżka mąki
1 łyżka masła

Mięso pokroić w kostkę. Cebulę pokroić w kosteczkę i zeszklić na oleju w dużym garnku. Dodać mięso i dokładnie je obsmażyć.
Wlać 2 szklanki gorącego bulionu lub wody z solą i pieprzem, zagotować. Następnie dodać połamane suszone grzyby, przykryć, zmniejszyć ogień i gotować przez ok. 45 minut.
Dodać listek laurowy, ziela angielskie, kminek, majeranek, powidła śliwkowe lub posiekane śliwki, obrane i pokrojone w kosteczkę obrane jabłko i wymieszać.
Dodać odciśniętą kiszoną kapustę oraz wlać szklankę wody, wymieszać. Przykryć i gotować przez ok. 15 minut.
Kiełbasę obrać ze skóry, pokroić w kostkę i podsmażyć na patelni. Dodać do kapusty i gotować przez ok. 30 minut. Pod koniec dodać koncentrat pomidorowy.
Mąkę podsmażyć na suchej patelni, gdy zacznie brązowieć dodać łyżkę masła i mieszać aż masło się rozpuści.
Trzymając patelnię na ogniu dodać stopniowo kilka łyżek kapusty cały czas mieszając. Przełożyć zawartość patelni z powrotem do garnka, wymieszać i zagotować.

i never write reviews, mostly because i feel stupid doing so, but after over 2,000 levels and 400 hours i feel almost obligated to write one for phasmophobia.

this game was bought for me as a gift, and even after receiving it i had to be nudged and forced to play it. for the first hundred levels at LEAST i was a "van andy" and when i did happen to venture out of the van, i got in and out of the house as fast as humanly possible because everything scared the ever-loving ♥♥♥♥ out of me. like "drop dead in the middle of the kitchen because the ghost started hunting, even though the ghost is right on top of me" kind of scared. as if it was a t-rex and wouldn't see me as long as i didn't move.
i admittedly still refuse to play it alone, but playing it with friends is one of my favorite past-times now. it's a GREAT coo-op game. i can wholeheartedly say that i love this game and would recommend it to someone wanting a cheap horror game that isn't too overwhelming in terms of the elements of horror it has in it. mechanically it will take a bit to get used to (especially when it comes to how certain pieces of equipment work) but it doesn't take too long to get the hang of it.

without being 'that guy', i suffer from some pretty severe depression and really awful apathy as a result - i look at my library of games and want to play nothing on most days. except phasmophobia.
phasmo is the right balance of predictable (the map layouts in particular, including where cursed possessions and power generators could be, and a defined list of ghosts that once you learn ghost personalities you can start to narrow down ghosts by what they do pretty quickly - most of the time) so that i can mostly turn my brain off, thrown down my equipment and relax but it's *just* unpredictable enough (you don't know what ghost it is right off the bat or where it could possibly be or when it could hunt, and events are at the whim of how that particular ghost is feeling that day, not to mention how spicy early demon or raiju hunts can be) to keep you on your toes and have you on edge when stuff starts to happen or you suddenly need to run for your life.
phasmo also doesn't really utilize jumpscares outside of sudden ghost events, which is an automatic win in my book and makes it better than most of the other horror games out there.

it's evident the devs are putting their heart into this game and are very good about listening to community feedback, and have been giving us more and more updates as of late, along with adding more staff to their relatively small team which i feel has slowed them down up until this point.
of course i would "love more maps/updates more frequently" but i can't complain about the amount of stuff we've gotten in a cheap game made by so few people. i know they're trying their hardest and that's all that matters to me.

as for criticism, i can't say i have many, except some pretty minor ones (most of which are goofy and very personal opinions), which are:
- get rid of shades.
- fine tune ghost personalities a *little* more, because having an oni that acts like a shade just isn't fun!
- consider adjusting some of the cursed possessions (honestly the only ones i care for are tarot cards, mirror and ouija) to make them more in line with each other (or potentially pair some up with others, especially ones LIKE tarot), because while i understand they all have their purpose, some are just downright boring to get (looking at you, music box). summoning circle on prison or asylum isn't great because it doesn't actually aid you in finding where the ghost is on such a large map, just in narrowing down ghost types by how fast it is or what evidence it leaves in its wake.
- the sound design has become kind of unbearable as of the most recent patch (imo) and pinpointing where something was touched or thrown from is fairly difficult at the moment on some maps (namely campsite). i can hear something *right* next to me but it winds up being in narnia instead, which is frustrating.
- "large" ghost rooms are painful to get, such as central path on campsite or the cellblocks on prison. i *think* that cellblock ghosts already have a right/left side classification to their room, but central path is way, way too big to make finding evidence any sort of manageable with how much ghosts wander around. from the bathrooms to the campfire shouldn't be one room. making it northern/southern central path would be better.
- i would also really, *REALLY* love a separate item slot for flashlights, which people can choose to utilize or not. i hate having a ghost in the back end of infirmary on prison and having to fumble around in the dark because i don't want to just bring *two* evidence items with me. i understand that i can make use of the lights inside the building more, which i admittedly don't do as often as i should, and that we don't want to bloat the amount of items you can carry in at one time, but this would be the biggest plus i can think of to the current game.

the long and short of it: good game. would recommend, especially with friends.

It is a fun game with friends to figure out where and what type the ghost is. Also creates funny moments while playing! As many have said before though the game lacks content. You can play it once every 3 weeks because the maps are easy to figure out after a while and new content is being pushed out slowly. If it is on sale for maybe 5 or 10 euros I would grab it, condition being you have friends to play it with. 

TL:DR: Fun to play with friends, has more potential if given more content. Wait for a sale.

If you're thinking if this game is worth it, it is. It's worth a thousand times its weight (when put on a thumbdrive, I don't know if this game has any physical releases).
I've played enough of this game that the usual gameplay doesn't phase me anymore, however, the game still [i]will[/i] scare the heck out of you. The design is amazing, the balance is amazing, the ambience is amazing, the maps are fun to play with, multiplayer works pretty much flawlessly, even in early access. 
The devs are super active and engage with the community a lot. I've honestly rarely seen feedback taken this well and this effectively (also CK if you're reading this, you are hilarious, love your streams <3). Yes, there are a few rough corners (emphasis on few), but this is something you [i]should[/i] experience. 11/10 would recommend to everyone.

[PS I hate horror movies, can't stand ghost stories. If I hadta watch one, I'd probably sleep with the lights on. But this game is somehow different. Even if you hate horror, give it a try, this is the good sort of horror :D]

[PS The High Priestess is Amazing and Lovely and Perfect and I love it]

after over 100 hours on phasmophobia i'll finally write a review. enjoy this poem basically summing up the entire game.

ahem

although the ghosts are anything but tame
phasmophobia is a beautiful game

at first you will probably be scared
only because you are unprepared
once you learn the game
(and to not say the ghost's name)
you'll discover each ghost with ease
every round will be a breeze

it helps if you learn each ghost's ability
in order to escape with more stability
for example yureis can fully close doors
sprit box + moroi drops that sanity of yours
phantoms really aren't photogenic
shades won't do squat if in the room with it

soon enough ghosts won't be the problem
your "teammates" will start to cause them
they will become the true threat
they'll start a hunt any chance they get
your goal won't be to escape in the end
but to get revenge on your "friend"

so go gather up your lads
and force them to hop on phas

But one little annoying thing I've noticed is, you don't run long enough during a hunt, 3 seconds of total running, you are out of breath and the ghost catches you creating a unfair moment.. If the dev could make it 5 seconds of running and 3 second cool down, that would be amazing for VR.

This game is fun. It makes for a good social game, as you have to talk in order to find out what ghost you're dealing with. There are many ghosts and equipment that allows for multiple ways to find the ghost. You can also summon the ghost through cursed objects, which in return it will hunt you down. The game is repetitive, but some how I don't get bored of it personally. There are -different difficulties allowing for harder or easier hunts. There are even ghost events, where the ghost "appears" and this sort of tricks you into thinking it's hunting making for some scary moments.  I give this game a 7-8/10. I feel this game is a lot better with friends, but if you have none, you can join lobbies where people actually talk. This game I feel won't be for everyone, but I think if you watch gameplay and think it's fun/funny, it's worth it.

This game knows what direction it would like to go in, and it feels whole in and of itself. It's fun, especially with friends and it's easy to form a good rhythm for when you're playing.
However, there are some major flaws and issues that come into play in terms of inefficiencies. A lot of small details, bugs, features, and mechanics that chafe when it all comes down to it. Making it exhausting to play it if you're not specifically looking for what it offers at the moment.

It's passable in VR, and it suffers from what I would assume is a lack of consideration. Overall, it would be a "Get it if you've got some money, and are looking for a VR game." Otherwise, to me, it feels like it would fall flat of a good valued purchase.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

For a game that's technically still in early access it's really well made. Very scary, visuals are good and it is compatible with even the lowest quality graphics card you can think of, you just have to turn the graphics down (for example I have a workstation with an Intel Core i7 3770 and integrated intel hd 4000 graphics and on lowest settings I average about 40-50 FPS and sometimes it even gets as high as 80). So overall, very good game, scary, well made, and the element about actually having to learn about the ghost rather than it just chasing after you constantly and you being scared is well done and adds a nice dimension of puzzle solving to what is essentially a horror game.

While, this game is great in single player mod. There is some serious issues for the online co-op.
1) When, you become a ghost. There is almost nothing you can really do. Having some features such as moving chairs / objects to help project your team-mates from wrathful sprites. Would go along way. In making dead players feel like they can do more than just wait for there team mates to finish the game .

2.) Every time your in a game lobby. If a person leaves / joins everyone has to re join the waiting list so the host player can start the game . The multiplayer matches needs to remove the constant reset statues . Just because, someone leaves / joins a host lobby . 

3). The sprint system is way to limited.  As you get better and things become, crazy . You will notice your sprint meter is painful to deal with . Generally you can only run 3 seconds before, your character gets tired . This is extremly unrealistic. An should be adjusted to make balance how long you can run. With how much gear your carrying, and how much weight they add up to . 

 Because, you will be running in big areas that have ghosts that can progressively get faster during a hunt. The speed of the character vs the ghosts is a bit unbalanced. An should be re-tweaked in a future update.

4) Xbox one controlls and vr controlls suffer drift . That makes Nintendo switch joy con swift look tame . With a xbox one controller. The player will constantly move in the wrong direction, go backwards , and move when you didnt want to . This could be a game config related issue. But, using non keyboard and mouse. Is the worst way to play phasmaphobia. 

 Overall, the game is great. But , the flaws do hurt the game from being great .

The devs are super active and their roadmap is always interesting. Although it seems every update they make brings with it its share of bugs, their fixes are (mostly) quick and alleviate a lot of the problems. Late-game Phasmophobia morphs from an investigative role-playing ghost hunting experience into a real gamey game. Ghosts are predictable, the scares seem cookie-cutter, and each run gets less and less mysterious, so I really hope their updates leading to the ultimate release can bring a lot of that magic back. But as it stands, it's still a great game to experience with friends.

Used to play this game back in February 2021. Where you could out walk ghosts, they weren't smart enough to go around corners if you lost LOS and if you weren't being hunted you could go right up to them with no consequences. Also sightings were far less common and they were far less aggressive. I was a champion, fearlessly going in, marching around and even going up to touch ghosts regularly. In the 40+ Missions we completed successfully (on max difficulty) I died once. And I wasn't scared either. Never even a single jump-scare; even when talking to ghosts alone in the dark.

Then they added an update ~March 2021. And everything changed. They could follow you around corners without line of sight. They were now faster. And gone were the days of running up to a ghost without consequence. On one of my first missions back we were progressing as normal. We saw no EMF and had some cold temperatures and were heading back to the truck to switch equipment when my light began to flash. No biggie. Had it a million times before. I was at the doorway to the house. Safe. looking inward with my torch flashing intermittently; awaiting the last of our group to come through. And then; as my torch flicked from dark to light, front and centre about 2m from me, a ghost appeared. 

I have never jumped so hard at anything in a game or otherwise. I recoiled from my computer; my hands retreating from mouse and keyboard alike. Even an audible gasp left my mouth. From that moment on I was a broken man.

Petrified to even do the simplest of ghost hunts. Every minute I was in a mission from then on I was counting down the time till we got out. Waiting for the real world clock to reach 'too late for another game' time. 

It broke me. If the idea of actually being scared, having cold sweaty palms, an undermining sense of anxiety just waiting for the mission to end appeals to you; then yes I recommend this game.

Game Name: Phasmophobia
Game Release: 2020
Genre Tags: Psychological Horror, Indie, Investigation, First Person, Co-op
Estimated Playtime: 100+ Hours
Personal Rating: 8/10

Review
Summary - Phasmophobia is an investigative horror game developed and published by British indie game studio, Kinetic Games. The game became available in early access through Steam for Microsoft Windows with virtual reality support in September 2020. The game received a large influx of popularity the following month due to many well-known Twitch streamers and YouTubers playing it, mainly for the Halloween season. As of October 15, 2020, the game was the sixth-most popular game on Twitch. It was the best selling game on Steam globally for several weeks in October to November 2020.

Gameplay - Phasmophobia is such a unique game to me. You go into a house or any environment this game has to offer (won’t give any spoilers) and your main goal is to figure out what ghost you are dealing with and get out. Sounds simple? Well not quite. You can buy many types of equipment to help you make your task easier and can use some of the equipment to do challenges. You want to make more money in a ghost haunt? You have to do the objectives on the white board and take pictures of the ghost, and any ghostly events that happen throughout your playthrough. You can have a total of four players into a game but the best and most scary experience is probably just two people total in my opinion. This game does get many bug fixes and some content updates which adds to the game’s replayability. You have many kinds of spirits and they all give different clues, and you can find these “possessed” items that make it easier for you to find the spirit or can make the game a bit more “interesting” but I will not spoil what they are. You do have progression, but nothing crazy yet, just levels. I want to unlock clothing, customization, something in that area to keep me playing for the long term.

Graphics - The graphics are okay in this game. Nothing groundbreaking or amazing. Well I guess I can say the lighting effects are really good and adds to the atmosphere but besides that nothing that will blow your mind. The game looks good and you won’t be disappointed with it. The animations are pretty solid for an early access game. The character and ghost models could use some work though in my opinion.

Sounds Design - The sound design is really good. You can hear objects turn off or on from the spirit. The spirit can also give you some minor jump scares which are pretty fun, like make a creepy noise in your ear. Spirit boxes do use your voice in this game and the spirit can hear you if you are being hunted so be quiet if you are in the hunting stage. You can hear your friends in the game and it sounds really good I have to say. I do wish they added more spooks in the sound design. For example how about some screaming or weird noises from the spirit or whispers in the dark. Scratching on the walls or doors slamming would be amazing in this game.

Pros:
Amazing atmosphere
Tons of ghost variety
Unique gameplay
Lots of maps
Frequent updates
Great optimization
Hunts are pretty scary
Amazing sound design
A ton of potential in the future

Cons:
Graphics could use some work
Animations need rework in some areas
Could add more spooks like doors slamming, scratches on the wall, etc
Needs to add more reason to play long term (progression for example)
Needs a steam workshop for longer replayability
Buy Phasmophobia Here!

If you enjoy detective style games and testing your nerves under pressure, get the game and happy ghost hunting!

TL;DR - Great game, a few glitches, some more game breaking than others, playable on bad PCs but still looks great on higher end PCs.
I usually don't do reviews and stuff like that, but I honestly love this game a lot. Obviously, there's some glitches and stuff like that, but to me that just kinda adds to the fun. The one time so far that I've encountered a really bad bug, I was playing with a friend and a couple of random people and we found the Tarot cards, someone pulled the one that starts a hunt and I died, someone else pulled the priest and revived me so then they stopped with the cards. Later that game someone died and got revived even though no one used the cards at all in the past like 5 minutes. Everyone took turns dying to be revived to laugh about it. We probably could've exploited it and gotten massive amounts of money by just dying and having people take pictures of the bodies, but we decided not to because that would just have been unfair. Other than that glitch, the game definitely doesn't look the greatest, but that's a good thing, at least to me, because my PC is horrible. I also can't even run Asylum, and if there are more than like 1 or 2 lights on in the house, the fps gets tanked, I can just tell people to not use the lights as much though. Whenever I load into a map the resolution switches to 1080p but my PC is bad so I have to run on 600x800 so that's a pain.

1: You do not need the required graphics it says you need, I am playing this on Irisxe Graphics and it works flawless however that might be different for VR. 2: You need a diaper and you mom to hold your hand while playing this becuase the ghost will get you when you least expect it. 3: Playing online is extremely fun and challenging bcuase working with a team has its ups and downs, but you can also go solo if you have balls of steel. Even when you die in game you still have a purpose which is to alert your team by throwing objects near them to try to inform them of their fate or perhaps evidence nearby. [h1] Awesome game [/h1]
Phasmophobia uses your microphone when playing, so you have to actually talk to the ghost and be quiet when it is hunting to not be found, which is a really cool feature.
In general, the game mechanics are easy to understand and fun, and it is for you to figure out which equipment you prefer and which you find unnecessary.
The graphics are also pretty nice, although sometimes bugs can occur. I for my part had to turn the graphic settings way down because my poor little laptop couldn't handle it, which was a little annoying at first, but now at least nothing lags anymore.
You can of course play the game alone, but I would recommend to play it with friends, as it is way more fun and can sometimes get pretty creepy when playing alone.
I'd definitely recommend you get the game and give it a try (if you like these kinds of games of course)!

A very fun and replayable ghost hunting game.

In this game, playing solo or in a group of up to four people, your goal is to collect as much evidence of the paranormal as you can without dying tragically. In the process, you will learn more about the different ghost types, including their behavior, sanity thresholds at which they can hunt a player, ghost speed during a hunt, unique hidden abilities, along with many other things.

For new players, I recommend joining the official Discord to find private lobbies to join, as public lobbies can be very toxic sometimes. Don't forget to do these things as well:

- Keep an eye on your sanity, especially if you're playing alone and are scared of being hunted.

- Remember to turn off your flashlights and stay quiet during hunts.

- Mic sensitivity in this game can be very touchy, so ultimately the best thing to do is apply "Push To Talk" to your mic settings, whether you're playing alone or in a group.

- Take lots of photos! It might not seem like an important task at first, but the money you can make from taking photos (and picking up the bones, if you can find them) can really add up.

- Play in whatever way you feel comfortable. Don't let toxic people tell you that you're playing the game wrong just because you're scared. Hell, as of now I have 300+ hours in this game and I'm around level 770, and yet I'm still too scared to get hunted in singleplayer unless I'm hiding beforehand and I'm using the Tarot Cards.

- Just have fun with it. Some people take this game very seriously, and that's fine. Other people might just play it as a way to have fun with others, and that's fine too. As someone who switches between both playstyles, I'm a firm believer that there isn't really a wrong way to play this game, as long as you're having fun and not being toxic.

I hope this review and mini guide was helpful; happy ghost hunting!

As someone who is a real-life chicken, this game is perfect. I hate jumpscares and finding a good horror or suspense game that doesn't cash in on them is next to impossible. Then this game exists. It hits every single one of my preferences: 
1. A scary game 
2. No jumpscares (the one in the lobby doesn't count as it's easily avoidable and just a gag). 
3. Coop available 
4. Can play alone (though it's much more difficult, but not impossible).
5. You get kind of a story but tons of freedom (I like having fun with friends imagining why they died and ended up in that area).
6. Your actions do affect the game, it's not a cookie cutter level each time. Your voice affects interactions with the ghost, where you are, what you use, all of it affects the game. I love it.
7. Your investigation matters- it literally is the point of the game.

If you're in that sweet spot of loving scary stuff but being afraid of approaching it unless your friends are there (to mock you every step of the way as friends do), this is the game for you. The events they do are fun, the game itself is fun, I literally could spend hours and hours on it and I looked forward to playing it after a stressful isolated workday. 

To be fair in this review, there are some downsides. I'd love an option where, if I die to the ghost, we could also whisper or do scary ghost howls or something similar to the players still alive. I would also love if there were more items to interact with in the lobby, sometimes friends take forever to load in. It's a little annoying to have other players in the way when I'm trying to choose items or a map in the lobby when the whiteboard is selected- if i'm clicking on the whiteboard to select options, players should not be able to get in the way when I do so. There's some clipping that happens in the game with the models which can make for hilarious jokes, but it gets old fast. 

However, these downsides are me really reaching for them. Overall it's a great game, great experience, and most definitely a fair price for the game as well. I'd love to see a single player story-mode available sometime in the future, but so far this game is phenomenal and tons of fun.

Even with those occasional bugs it's still really good! Money well spent.

This game is addicting to play with friends or even certain randoms you run across. Phas only has a small team working on it yet bug fixes and patches come quite regularly. The developers are consistent with their content and they have a good community backing them with people such as Insym and Psycho for example. The game can also be quite complex but simple once you have figured everything out, and you're always one moment away from something funny happening. I have had some great moments with great people. Phas has great value for its price and I recommend buying it and playing with friends. 

Pros: 
-Great, complex gameplay but easy to learn once you understand it.
-Playing by yourself is cool, but more fun with friends
-Quite addicting
-Great community
-Quality content creators (Youtube and Twitch)
-Frequent bug fixes and content updates
-Developers and moderators engage with the community
-Can still find ways to scare you hundreds of hours in
-VR gameplay is good and consistently gets updates to make it better
-Price of the game is very good for the amount of content provided

Cons:
-Can get extremely repetitive after some time. Burnout can sometimes occur.
-VR can still be buggy on occasion
-Every game has trolls, and this is no exception. Use your best judgement when playing with randoms

10/10 would recommend. Worth every penny.
Awsome multiplayer horror games with friends or solo

Incredible potential but still a work in progress. The game is something completely new unlike anything I've played before. It is one of the few horror games to genuinely build tension and deliver scares and the mechanics can force players into tense decisions about whether it is worth the risk to return to the house to find that last piece of evidence or if your sanity is so low you might be attacked the second you set foot in the door.

The evidence gathering manages to be fun while still being similar from round to round and each mechanic does a good job of immersing the player in the game. At first nothing is creepier than getting a ghost to respond to you on spirit box saying he is right behind you.

 However the imersion of the gameplay begins to wane after the first few levels acheived and the once imposing ghosts become more of a nuisance than a threat barring RNG giving you the 1 in 12 chance of picking the most dangerous ghost type. I hope more work can be done on this game to preserve the experience I had on my first hunt as a greenhorn ghost hunter unsure if any second an otherworldly being could end my existence. Perhaps more varied goals or unpredictable hunting behavior would force methodical veteran hunters to take risks or face the uncertainty that terrifies you when first playing this game.

So look, I know there are some really amazing game players out there, and I love watching them play games like these. But us amateurs like to play games, too. When this game first came out, it was amazing, fun and easy to understand, easy to follow, but since all the updates that have been released making this game harder, me and my kids can't even get past intermediate level. And it's killed the experience for us. Not being able to tell the ghost is hunting until it's right up your ass? Is entirely unfair. This game has become, just like so many others of my favorites, made for youtubers only or for people who are badass at video games. You take away the fun for those of us who are casual players who just want to get on here and there and have a good time. I paid money for this game, but I refuse to play until something is implemented that allows us to bring back the ability to tell when the ghost is hunting, and an actual way to run away from the ghost. Run away, Hah.. What a freaking joke. This has really come down hill since the updates started coming out more frequently, and I am not a happy customer.

Really fun multiplayer experience. Super creepy on single player as well. Large variety of ghosts, and a large series of maps. Public lobbies are pretty fun as well, plenty of people are willing to walk you through the strategies they've developed. That being said, people are people, and not everyone is here to be inclusive and chill. Welcome to the internet.

The early time can be rough as you try to grind for money to purchase the items you need, but once you establish your bank, it becomes a lot more relaxing from that aspect.

This is one of my go-to games for just popping on my computer for a quick game if I have a few minutes free during the day. I hope you enjoy it as much as I do.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories

Phasmophobia is truly a gem in the horror community because it defies everything the genre has become in recent years. Instead of aiming for grotesque "shock-value" horror riddled with bland and predictable jumpscares, the game offers you a grounded horror setting that doesn't feel alien beyond belief. It's a breath of fresh air in the gaming industry, and I'm excited to see the direction it takes. With devs capable of providing consistency in both the frequency and quality of the updates, this game truly is a wonderful experience, and one I wish I could sink more time into.

I've put a few hours into this game and I just don't enjoy it. It's like playing a normal video game but you can only see through a toilet paper roll. Some people seem to enjoy it but it's just so technically unpolished that I can't get to enjoy the mystery aspects of the game. I've been playing mostly with experienced people which has it's own drawbacks but most of the time I don't have any idea what's going on  if they don't tell me.

I've tried to play by myself but I get less than a minute in and I'm having so much [Anti-Fun] fighting the game design I can't bring myself to continue. I do not see the appeal of this game. I want to love it. Conceptually there's a lot I'd like to try and it's why I keep booting it up but every time it's like shocking again how badly the gameplay hates me. "Oh it wasn't that bad" I say to myself, "Surely if I give it another chance it might be better than I remember". Nope. It's worse.

This isn't a slight against the developers. Clearly a lot of people love the game, my friends included, and while there is *some* ugly design in there I don't think the game is broken per se. But I play games to have some sort of fun or enjoyment and I can't possibly bring myself to enjoy this game no matter how hard I try. The idea that gamers complain about games like Resident Evil's "tank" controls and then play games like this gleefully just baffles me.

This game is incredibly fun and is updated regularly. The game is about 2 years old and I have owned it for a couple months but through consistent updating and polishing it looks so much better than it did. The game also doesn't rely on jumpscares to induce fear on the player which is good because jumpscares have become cheap and un-creative. This game is one of many games that are easy to learn but hard to master. Also, practically every game is different due to the range of ghost types and differences between each map. Overall I would give this game a try and do not regret getting this game.

When I first started playing this game I was scared out of mind. To the point I took my headset off during a hunt. But with more and more hours I've found plenty of ways to play this game and enjoy it.
(To be fair I've rarely play this game alone, and rarely without 4 people, and never anything put professional)

Learning this game will be the deciding factor if you have fun or not. Simply being able to know the weaknesses of the ghost and how to play around them (Aka getting friends killed for fun). Is honestly fun. Once you hit around 20 hours it will be incredibly easy to drop into a professional find the ghost get all pictures and obj's and leave with no deaths.

But as a tip to the newer players. Don't sit in the van. Get in as soon as u can and identify the hiding spots (closets, places with obv corners covered with boxes. (Aka Super spots). and just run to that spot 24/7. Get to know the game. And start having fun. 

Once you know the ghost and aren't as scared Start moving into professional difficulty. (for more moneyz). Professional gets boring? Fuck flashlights starting using video cameras (actually really good. Lets u find rooms based on dots).

Game to easy now? starting doing the obj's. Get them feet picks (give them a sniff). AND MURDER YOUR FRIENDS. Get the boogie bomb (music box) and drop that shit at their feet. Use summoning circle when they don't know. Walk past their closet getting chased and open it. Break the mirror for fun. Idk just make sure you get the items. and have at least helped get one-two evidence.

Over all New ghost are a W. Enjoy the game. Don't think its a hard game. (P.S. fuck the big maps, They take super long to find the room. For those make sure u bring everything. Smaller maps. bring only what u need).

My experience with this game is positive but if you are buying this game to get scared, you shouldn't play with other people as it may ruin the experience.

At the time of writing, I have over 630 hours in this game -- the most hours I have put into ANY game in a very long time!

This is hands-down one of my all-time faves. I love anything spooky but most horror games tend to go too far with it, consisting of too many jumpscares and truly unnecessary violent or gory visuals. But Phasmophobia is a wonderful mix of suspense and intrigue that I am all for. No round ever feels the same way twice, especially when you play multiplayer!

I LOVE multiplayer. It's pure chaos that often leads to a lot of laughs. I love the party game vibes it gives, especially on smaller maps where the rounds are shorter.

It helps, too, that the devs are always tinkering with the game and giving us something to look forward to. My only critique here is that I do wish a little less time was spent on giving us more ghosts as opposed to new maps. This far along in the game, I'd much rather have new maps to explore than even more ghosts, especially since there are already so many ghosts that you're unlikely to experience even the same ghost twice in a good few hours of playing.

Honestly great game but I do have an issue with a few things.. Why the F8ck do you have Yokai but have Oni and Yurai.. Oni and Yurais are in fact Yokai! Developers either did not know what the term Yokai means or they just said screw put them in. Yokai is a term that means ghost or types of ghosts: Kappa, Oni, Yurai are types of Yokai. It just doesn't make sense to have a word that means types of ghosts then proceed to have the very types. Yokai isn't a specific type of ghost. The word itself covers a larger group of ghosts. At least fix that. It doesn't make any sense since my Japanese friend of mine called it out when we were playing and got pretty mad about that discrepancy. Which I can see why he got upsete after looking it up myself, didn't make much sense.

I got this game for me and around 5 or 6 friends. I spent probably over a hundred dollars on buying this game for people and I dont regret a penny of it.
This is one of the best games I've ever played, and its so easy and simple to pick up too.
You go into a house either alone or with up to 3 friends and you attempt to find evidence to identify the ghost type, and all of the constantly growing amount of ghosts have different special abilities that make them unique. A lot of people have complained that the game has too many ghosts, as far back as when the Hantu and Yokai were added, however I say it gives the game more replayability personally. 
I must admit, after some time, the game becomes quite easy even on nightmare, but maybe this is because my crew has a hatred for anything larger than a streethouse, so 99% of the time I'm playing Tanglewood. 
Another thing is that Kinetic Games isn't exactly a big studio from my understanding so major updates (like the horror update and upgrade system and such) take a long time to come out, however they do seem to be able to pump out new ghosts pretty frequently. 
The game has definitely become a little more scary than on release with better looking ghost models and on larger maps not even knowing if its hunting at times (especially with Mylings, since they are typically very hard to hear from a distance, yes I've died this way) which is a good thing, I recommend VR, sadly my Meta Quest 2 won't work with PCVR anymore so I don't know how stable VR is, but its a lot more terrifying at times. I recommend once you get a feel for the game (level 40 or so) to play nightmare, as trying to discover a ghost based off behavior is a lot more entertaining than sitting and waiting for a third piece of evidence.
My favorite ghost has to be a Deagon, as it forces you out of hiding and gives that old Phasmophobia feel where you could just loop any ghost around a table if your caught.
This review is kind of drawn out by now so I'll just put it to this, the game is insanely good, especially if you have some good friends to joke around with during the games, but it is easy.

When the game first came out it was a fun interesting concept for a game, now with a drip feed of content updates and better alternatives (Forewarned, its like Phasmophobia with mummies and stuff actually happens) it is extremely boring. Every single time I boot up this game thinking it might be fun, it's the same thing.

DONT EVEN GET ME STARTED ON THE VR. The controls for index are putrid. The index controllers have grip functionality so you would think to hold an item you just hold the grip, but no you have to tap the grip then let go of the controller and when you want to holster or drop you grip again. There is an alternate control scheme, but instead you have to squeeze the shit out of your controllers and it still randomly drops things. For the cherry on top, the only way to sprint is to click in the sticks which with the bad build quality on the index controllers can cause drift.

Overall fun for the first couple times you play it, but by the time you think its getting started, you've seen everything.

I've always been fascinated by ghost hunting shows & movies; I had no idea I was waiting for this game to be made. I bought it as soon as I saw some of my favorite youtubers playing it. I wanted to experience what they were experiencing but with my own friends. I don't have VR (yet) but playing desktop is just as rewarding. 

With that said (I am a bit biased) but I will review it as a game below:
PC performance:
-runs hot on any of the PCs I've played on (2016 laptop & beefcake 2022 PC)
-the speech recognition can bug out sometimes
Graphics:
-realistic, a bit wonky models (for the time being)
-audio within the game is terrifying (in a good way)
Replayability:
-endless. I really do mean this; each mission is it's own experience. However, some missions take FOREVER (like 40mins+) because the AI of the ghosts choose to do nothing to give you evidence. Majority of missions take 10-20 mins on the small/medium maps.
-maps: can become boring and repetitive (the dev team is constantly adding content so this might be outdated review when out of early access)
Multiplayer:
-whole reason I bought the game(I'm not brave enough to play alone), rarely have connection issues. Audio bugs do happen, though, of other players cutting out or robotizing
Dev responsiveness:
-incredible. The team behind this really do love what they're making and it shows. Worth every penny; they update the game consistently and don't charge more from the players and that might be overlooked.
Ridiculously fun with friends, better when experienced in VR.
